ismene: <entryFree id="n25061" type="main" key="Isme_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ismh/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n25061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Œdipus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:623" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 623</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ismenias: <entryFree id="n25062" type="main" key="Isme_ni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismēnĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ismhni/as.</foreign> <sense id="n25062.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Theban flute-player</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 3, § 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25062.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Theban general</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:9:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ismenus: <entryFree id="n25063" type="main" key="Isme_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismēnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ismhno/s,</foreign> <sense id="n25063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:40" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 404</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25063.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n25063.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismēnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <pb n="1005" /> <cb n="ISTA" /> = <foreign lang="greek">*)ismh/nios,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ismenus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ismenian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 682</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Polynices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:307" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 307</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25063.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismēnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ismhni/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a Theban woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 169</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">733</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isocinnamon: <entryFree id="n25064" type="greek" key="i_so^cinna^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsŏcinnămon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)soki/nnamon,</foreign> <sense id="n25064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an odoriferous shrub resembling cinnamon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 20, 43, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isocrates: <entryFree id="n25065" type="main" key="I_so^cra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsŏcrătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)isokra/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n25065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Isocrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated orator and teacher of rhetoric at Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Gorgias and the friend of Plato</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56, 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 79</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n25065.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsŏcrătēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Isocrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Isocratic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:207" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 207</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 23</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsŏcrătīus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Isocrates</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isodomos: <entryFree id="n25066" type="greek" key="i_so^do^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsŏdŏmos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)sodomos,</foreign> <sense id="n25066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">equally</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evenly built</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus isodomon,</quote> <trans><tr>a mode of building in which the courses of bricks or stones are uniform in thickness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isoetes: <entryFree id="n25067" type="greek" key="i_so^e^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsŏĕtes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)soe/tes,</foreign> <sense id="n25067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small houseleek</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ayegreen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isopleuros: <entryFree id="n25068" type="greek" key="i_so^pleuros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsŏpleuros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)so/pleuros,</foreign> <sense id="n25068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">equilateral</hi>, Aus. praef. ad Idyll. 13.</sense></entryFree>
isopyron: <entryFree id="n25069" type="greek" key="i_so^py_ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsŏpȳron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)so/puron,</foreign> <sense id="n25069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 70, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isosceles: <entryFree id="n25070" type="greek" key="i_sosce^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsoscĕles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)soskelh/s,</foreign> <sense id="n25070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having equal legs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">isosceles</hi>, Aus. praef. ad Idyll. 13.</sense></entryFree>
israel: <entryFree id="n25071" type="main" key="Isra_^el"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Isrā^ël</orth>, <itype>ēlis</itype> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 7</bibl>, scanned with <sense id="n25071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> short), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Israel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">another name of the patriarch Jacob</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 650</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:32:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 32, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25071.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25071.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The descendants of Israel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Israelites</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locutus est ad omnem Israel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 21, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Cor. 10, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25071.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The people of God</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax super ... Israel Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 11, 26</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25071.4" n="III" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n25071.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Isrāēlītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Israelites</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> Act. Apost. 1, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Sam. 14, 22.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnes qui ex Israel, ii sunt Israelitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 9, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Joh. 1, 47</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl>.—In appos.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum viro Israelita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen viri Israelitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 25, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25071.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Isrāēlītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Israelitish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 192</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 20; 16, 16.— </sense><sense id="n25071.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Isrāē-lītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Israelitish woman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 70</bibl>, n. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 24, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
issa: <entryFree id="n25072" type="main" key="Issa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Issa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/issa,</foreign> <sense id="n25072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Adriatic Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a town of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lissa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 9</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25072.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n25072.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Issaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Issa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Issæan; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Issaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Issa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 45</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25072.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Issaĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Issæan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25072.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Issensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Issæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Issenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Issa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isse: <entryFree id="n25073" type="main" key="Isse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Issē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of the Lesbian king Macareus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who is said to have been seduced by Apollo under the form of a shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
issicus: <entryFree id="n25074" type="main" key="Issi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Issĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Issus, II.</entryFree>
issulus: <entryFree id="n25075" type="main" key="issu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">issŭlus</orth>, <sense id="n25075.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
issus: <entryFree id="n25076" type="gloss" key="issus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">issus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n25076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a childish form of</hi> ipse, <hi rend="ital">used with little children as a term of endearment</hi>: ISSA HAVE, Inscr. ap. Fabr. p. 45, n. 255.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Issa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a pet slut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:109" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 109</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">dim.</hi>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">issŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, Inscr. ap. Fabr. n. 254.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25077" type="main" key="Issus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Issus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)isso/s,</foreign> <sense id="n25077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Mediterranean</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the Gulf of Issus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gulf of Iskenderun</hi>), <hi rend="ital">at the foot of Mount Amanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Darius was defeated by Alexander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25077.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Issĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Issus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Gulf of Issus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 243</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
istac: <entryFree id="n25078" type="main" key="ista_c"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istāc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> ( = istā viā), <sense id="n25078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that way</hi> (ante-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">exi istac per hortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25078.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> ( = eo modo), <hi rend="ital">in that way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in such wise</hi>: nequaquam istuc istac ibit: magna inest certatio, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (Trag. v. 304 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">istac indico,</quote> <trans><tr>on this side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 101</bibl></cit>. <cb n="ISTH" /></sense></entryFree>
istactenus: <entryFree id="n25079" type="hapax" key="istacte^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istac-tĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n25079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thus far</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istactenus tibi, Lyde, libertas data'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
istaec: <entryFree id="n25080" type="main" key="istaec"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istaec</orth>, v. istic.</entryFree>
istaevones: <entryFree id="n25081" type="main" key="Istaevo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Istaevŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (al. Istyaeŏnes), <sense id="n25081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient people of Germany bordering on the Rhine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iste: <entryFree id="n25082" type="main" key="iste"><orth extent="full" lang="la">iste</orth>, <itype>a, ud</itype>, <sense id="n25082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> istīus (the poets often make the penult of the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> short: <cit><quote lang="la">istĭus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius, dissyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:76 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 76 al.</bibl>— An old form of the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> isti, with modi, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 694</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 38</bibl>.— With affixed <hi rend="ital">ce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istisce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; and in interrogations, <hi rend="ital">cine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istoscine patrem aequum'st mores liberis largirier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 82</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> isto, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, 31, p. 172 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; <hi rend="ital">dat. f.</hi> istae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 38</bibl>.—Shortened form, ste, sta, stoc, etc.; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 476</bibl>; Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:954" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 954</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">pron. demonstr.</hi> [compounded of two pronom. stems, i- (cf. is) and to-; Sanscr. -ta; cf. tam, tum], <hi rend="ital">this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> (man, woman, thing), called the <hi rend="ital">demonstr. of the second person</hi>, since it is especially used in reference to persons and things connected in place, relation, or thought, with the person addressed. </sense><sense id="n25082.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n25082.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That</hi> (person or thing) <hi rend="ital">near to you</hi> (in place or thought), <hi rend="ital">that of yours</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that of which you speak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with which you are connected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ista nobis cogitatio de triumpho injecta non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istae minae,</quote> <trans><tr>those threats of yours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de istis rebus exspecto tuas litteras,</quote> <trans><tr>those affairs of yours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quod adventu tuo ista subsellia vacuefacta sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>those seats where you are sitting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 17, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est ista praetura?</quote> <trans><tr>that prætorship of yours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaevis mallem fuisset (causa), quam ista quam dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25082.3" n="2" level="3"> So with <hi rend="ital">pronom. of the second person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum enim tuus iste Stoicus sapiens dixerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid iste tuus vates donat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste vester (sapiens),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tua est ista vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25082.4" n="B" level="2"> With a general reference, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that particular</hi> (person or thing), <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25082.5" n="1" level="3"> Alone, as <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae quae cum isto cubant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credis quod iste dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quae ista elementa videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 163</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25082.6" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat enim ab isto Aristotele, a cujus inventis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista divina studia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam ne istius quidem rei culpam sustineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim ab isto officio abduci debui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25082.7" n="3" level="3"> With other <hi rend="ital">pronouns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius ipsius in dicendo facultatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:29:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 29, 128</bibl></cit>: transeat idem iste sapiens ad rem publicam tuendam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:25:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 25, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eodem isto Aegyptio regno vitā privatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 23</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25082.8" n="4" level="3"> With the <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est eam, quae suum corpus prodixerit turpissimae cupiditati, timere permultos. Quos istos? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25082.9" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25082.10" n="A" level="2"> Like <hi rend="ital">is</hi> in the sense of tantus and talis, <hi rend="ital">such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of such a kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare cum ista sis auctoritate, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi mei, si me isto pacto metuerent, ut te metuunt omnes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ista auctoritate praediti, qua vos estis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo isto esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egon, quidquam cum istis factis tibi respondeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25082.11" n="B" level="2"> It freq. implies scorn or contempt: <cit><quote lang="la">non erit ista amicitia, sed mercatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste otii et pacis hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi est ista mollities, non virtus, inopiam paulisper ferre non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vestis cum isto squalore permutandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:16" default="NO">3, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus iste frater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o isti, an urgent form of address,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 23, 36</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n25082.12" n="C" level="2"> In the <case>abl.</case>: isto, <hi rend="ital">for this reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isto tu's pauper, quom nimis sancte piu's,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ister: <entryFree id="n25083" type="main" key="Ister"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ister</orth>, v. Hister.</entryFree>
isthmus: <entryFree id="n25084" type="main" key="Isthmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Isthmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)isqmo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n25084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strip of land between two seas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an isthmus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO">2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25084.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the Isthmus of Corinth</hi>, where the Isthmian games were celebrated, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:55:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 55, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 5, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 406</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25084.2" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a strait</hi>, viz., <hi rend="ital">the Dardanelles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:21:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 21, 1</bibl> (4, 22, 2).—</sense><sense id="n25084.3" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. <cb n="ISTI" /> </sense><sense id="n25084.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Isthmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/isqmios,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Isthmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Isthmian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: Dione, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>, who had a temple at Corinth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 2</bibl>.—Esp. freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Isthmĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *)/isqmia,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the Isthmian games</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated every five years at the Isthmus of Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the victors in which received a pine garland</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25084.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Isthmĭăcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Isth-mĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Isthmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Isthmian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:557" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 463</bibl></cit>: coloni, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Syracusans</hi> (as a colony of Corinth), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:341" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 341</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">favillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:68" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 68</bibl></cit>.—Form Isthmicus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isti: <entryFree id="n25085" type="main" key="isti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">isti</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. istic <sense id="n25085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
istic: <entryFree id="n25086" type="main" key="istic1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istic</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">isthic</orth>), <itype>aec, oc, and uc</itype>, <sense id="n25086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. demonstr.</hi> [for iste-ce; v. Neue, Formenl. II. p. 211 sqq.], <hi rend="ital">this same</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the very</hi> (person or thing). </sense><sense id="n25086.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n25086.2" n="A" level="2"> Substantively: <cit><quote lang="la">isne istic fuit, quem vendidisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid istic narrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25086.3" n="B" level="2"> With a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, usually with special reference to the person addressed, <hi rend="ital">that of yours</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that mentioned by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">related to you</hi> (cf. iste): <cit><quote lang="la">istac lege filiam tuam sponden mihi dari?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum istoc ornatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istic labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud istoc modo solita se me ante appellare,</quote> <trans><tr>as you now do</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istic servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Sos.</hi> Egone? <hi rend="ital">Amph.</hi> Tu istic, <hi rend="ital">you yourself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis istic est qui deos tam parvi pendit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec miseria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum istoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum istaec loca commorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl></cit>, C, 1.—</sense><sense id="n25086.4" n="C" level="2"> Esp., in <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi> and <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">si istuc ita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc quidem considerabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo istoc magis, quia vanilocu's, vapulabis,</quote> <trans><tr>so much the more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istoc vilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicitur, quidem, istuc, inquit, a Cotta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc fractum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 26, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non posse istaec sic abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid istuc est verbi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc aeta tis homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25086.5" n="II" level="1"> Esp., with the demonstr. particle <hi rend="ital">ce</hi>, and in interrogations <hi rend="ital">cine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istucine interminata sum hinc abiens tibi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5</bibl></cit>. 1, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istocine pacto me adjutas?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaece ridicularia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25087" type="main" key="istic2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istic</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">isti</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 28</bibl> Brix ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 661</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 557</bibl> Rib.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for isti-ce</etym>, <sense id="n25087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25087.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">cave cuiquam indicassis aurum meum esse istic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heus! vos pueri! Quid istic agitis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid istic habitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego te re istic prodesse: hic ne verbo quidem levare me posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi malis esse ... quam istic ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istic nunc metuende jace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 557</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid istic tibi negoti est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu istic mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 70</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25087.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">herein</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in this affair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on this occasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque istic, neque alibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: Ausculta. <hi rend="ital">Phi.</hi> Istic sum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istic sum, inquit, exspectoque quid respondeas,</quote> <trans><tr>I am listening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:26:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 26, 78 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: rem publicam ut vos istic expedistis, ita, pro nostrā parte, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">on that side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on your side</hi>, Cassiod. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
istim: <entryFree id="n25088" type="main" key="istim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>iste</etym>, <sense id="n25088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to that place</hi> (very rare): nolite, hospites, ad me adire! ilico istim! Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 404" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 404</bibl> Vahl., and Trag. Rel. v. 303 Rib., isti, in the same meaning): <cit><quote lang="la">quod eos usque istim exauditos putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit> (Klotz, but Baiter reads istinc): <cit><quote lang="la">ite istim, ecferte lora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 125</bibl></cit> (acc. to Lachm. ad Lucr. vol. 2, p. 189; al. istinc).</sense></entryFree>
istimodi: <entryFree id="n25089" type="main" key="isti_mo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istīmŏdi</orth>, v. istiusmodi.</entryFree>
istinc: <entryFree id="n25090" type="main" key="istinc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istinc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>istim-ce; cf. hinc, illinc</etym>, <sense id="n25090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thence</hi>, i. e. from the place of the person addressed, or a place related to that person. </sense><sense id="n25090.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">istinc loquere, si quid vis: procul tamen audiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 71</bibl></cit>: serva istas fores, ne tibi clam se subterducat istinc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">age alter istinc, alter hinc adsistite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istinc excludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1006" /> <cb n="ITA" />qui istinc veniunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 389</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25090.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thereof</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of that thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memento dimidium istinc mihi de praeda dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ergo partem posco mihi istinc de istoc vidulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
istiusmodi: <entryFree id="n25091" type="main" key="isti_usmo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istīus-mŏdi</orth> (also separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">istīus mŏdi</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">istīmŏdi</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 38</bibl>), <sense id="n25091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of that kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius modi amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius modi clientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum istius modi virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos esse istius modi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istiusmodi ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil istiusmodi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>, § 9.</sense></entryFree>
isto: <entryFree id="n25092" type="main" key="isto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>iste</etym>, <sense id="n25092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thither</hi>, with reference to the place where the person addressed is. </sense><sense id="n25092.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">do fidem, si omittis, isto me intro ituram, quo jubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isto venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peream si minima causa est properandi isto mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 17, 2: isto usque penetrasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25092.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thereinto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebatium meum, quod isto admisceas, nihil est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>; v. iste.</sense></entryFree>
istoc: <entryFree id="n25093" type="main" key="istoc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istoc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>istic</etym>, <sense id="n25093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yonder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemquam istoc ad vos intromittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accede illuc: nimium istoc abisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; v. also istic.</sense></entryFree>
istorsum: <entryFree id="n25094" type="main" key="istorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istorsum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>isto-versum</etym>, <sense id="n25094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thitherwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concede hinc a foribus paululum istorsum, sodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
istri: <entryFree id="n25095" type="main" key="Istri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Istri</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Histri</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Istria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Istrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25095.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n25095.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Istrĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hist-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">a country of Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Adriatic Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and bordering on Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25095.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Istrĭ-āni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hist-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Istria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Istrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:2:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25095.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Istrĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hist-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Istria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Istrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 62</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25095.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Istrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hist-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Istrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Istrian oil in Istrian jars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:63:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 63, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
istuc: <entryFree id="n25096" type="main" key="istuc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istuc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>isto- (iste) ce</etym>, <sense id="n25096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thither</hi>, esp. in reference to the place where the party addressed is: <cit><quote lang="la">concedite istuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc eo quantum potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam istuc ego revortar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabam operam, ut istuc veniam ante quam plane ex animo tuo effluo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc mens animusque Fert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum transferor istuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 205</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25096.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to that thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to that subject</hi> in discourse, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quod coepi primum enarrem: Post istuc veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio: istuc ibam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
istucine: <entryFree id="n25097" type="main" key="istuci^ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">istucĭne</orth>, v. 1. istic.</entryFree>
isturgi: <entryFree id="n25098" type="main" key="Isturgi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Isturgi</orth>, v. Iprasturgi.</entryFree>
istyaeones: <entryFree id="n25099" type="main" key="Isty^aeo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Istyaeŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl> (Jan.).</sense></entryFree>
ita: <entryFree id="n25100" type="main" key="i^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭta</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pronom. stem i-; cf. is; Sanscr. itthā; Zend, itha</etym>, in the manner specified, <sense id="n25100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in this manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this wise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in such a way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thus.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25100.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n25100.2" n="A" level="2"> Referring to what precedes, <hi rend="ital">as has been said</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">des operam ut investiges sitne ita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 17</bibl></cit>: vidi ego nequam homines, verum te nullum deteriorem. <hi rend="ital">Phil.</hi> Ita sum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita aiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et hercule ita fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum est ita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aiunt enim te ita dictitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:64:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 64, § 151</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">frequent in phrase: quae cum ita sint,</quote> <trans><tr>since what has been said is true</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum ita sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum ita essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 34, 94 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n25100.3" n="B" level="2"> To introduce the thought which follows, <hi rend="ital">thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the following manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as follows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tertio de oratore ita scriptum est, in perpetua, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ita digerunt: primum ... secundum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sciunt procuratores ... nullius apud te auctoritatem valere plus quam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 42, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita constitui, fortiter esse agendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 19, 51</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25100.4" n="C" level="2"> In affirmations, esp. in replies, <hi rend="ital">yes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi>: quid istic tibi negoti est? <hi rend="ital">Dav.</hi> Mihin'? <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Ita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an laudationes? ita, inquit Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Davusne? ita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; so in solemn affirmation: est ita: est, judices,<cb n="ITA" />  ita, ut dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et certe ita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in negations: non est ita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:section=158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, § 158</bibl></cit>; strengthened by other particles of affirmation: as vero, profecto, prorsus, plane; <cit><quote lang="la">ita vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita profecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est profecto ita, judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita prorsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus ita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita plane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 113</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25100.5" n="D" level="2"> In interrogations, esp. </sense><sense id="n25100.6" n="a" level="4"> Jeeringly, implying an affirmative, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/lhqes</foreign>: itane? <hi rend="ital">really? truly? is it so?</hi> itane credis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itane est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 113</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with vero or tandem: itane vero? ego non justus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:30:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 30, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itane tandem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 65, 182</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25100.7" n="b" level="4"> Where surprise or reproach is implied: quid ita? (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ti dai/</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">why so? how is that? what do you mean?</hi> accusatis Sex. Roscium. Quid ita? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ita passus est Eretriam capi? quid ita tot Thessaliae urbes? Quid ita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 21, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 34, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 42</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n25100.8" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25100.9" n="A" level="2"> In comparisons, <hi rend="ital">so.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25100.10" n="1" level="3"> To point out the resemblance, usually corresponding to ut; sometimes to quasi, quomodo, quemadmodum, quam, tamquam, veluti, qualis, etc., <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the same way as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita amo ut sani solent homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut res sese habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita vero, Quirites, ut precamini, eveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis enim pecunia ita tractatur, ut praeda, a praefectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ita tu's animata, ut qui expers matris imperiis sies?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homost, ita morem geras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hirundines ... ita falsi amici, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 48, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi ita de meo facto loquor, quasi ego illud mea voluntate fecerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed prorsus ita, quasi aut reus numquam esset futurus, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>, § 49; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me consulem ita fecistis, quomodo pauci facti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum dicimus non feci furtum, ita, non est hoc furtum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita variant undae ... quam facile mutantur amantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra in hostico incuriose ita posita, tamquam procul abesset hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim ita se gessit tamquam rationem aliquando esset redditurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander ita cupide profectus fuerat, veluti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane ita se habet sacrum, quale apud Homerum quoque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25100.11" n="2" level="3"> Following or followed by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, to denote that two things are in the same condition or category. </sense><sense id="n25100.12" n="(a)" level="5"> Ut ... ita, <hi rend="ital">as ... so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as ... so also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alike ... and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as well ... as</hi>: Dolabellam ut Tarsenses, ita Laodiceni multo amentiores ultro arcessierunt, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules cum ut Eurysthei filios, ita suos configebat sagittis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25100.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Ut ... ita, <hi rend="ital">although ... yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut errare potuisti, sic decipi te non potuisse quis non videt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia ut invitis, ita non adversantibus patriciis transacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.; <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque Alpium sicut breviora ita arrectiora sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 35, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25100.14" n="(g)" level="5"> Ita ut, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut occoepi dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut antea demonstravimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 144, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25100.15" n="3" level="3"> In oaths, emphatic wishes, solemn assertions, etc., expressed by a comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ille faxit Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: ita me di ament, non nil timeo, i.e. may they <hi rend="ital">so</hi> love me <hi rend="ital">as</hi> it is true that, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sim felix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitat, ita vivam, me tua valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 208</bibl>; so, followed by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mihi salvā re publicā vobiscum perfrui liceat, ut ego non moveor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me Venus amet, ut ego te numquam sinam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me amabit sancta Saturitas, itaque suo me condecoret cognomine, ut ego vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 97</bibl></cit>; by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, adding a second wish: <cit><quote lang="la">nam tecum esse, ita mihi omnia quae opto contingant, ut vehementer velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; for which the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: ita incolumi Caesare moriar, Balb. ap. Cic. Att. <cb n="ITAL" /> 9, 7, B, 3; for the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> with ita, the <hi rend="ital">fut. indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita te amabit Juppiter, ut tu nescis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 22</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25100.16" n="B" level="2"> To denote a kind or quality, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of this nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of this kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ita est ingenium muliebre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita est amor: balista ut jacitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sunt res nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sunt Persarum mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ita sum, non tam est admirandum regem esse me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 27, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita inquam = hoc dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25100.17" n="C" level="2"> To denote an expected or natural consequence, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under these circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita praetorium missum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita Jovis illud sacerdotium per hanc rationem Theomnasto datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; esp.: ita fit, <hi rend="ital">thus it comes to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hence it follows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fit ut animus de se ipse tum judicet, cum id ipsum, quo judicatur, aegrotet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 45, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fit ut deus ille nusquam prorsus appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl>; so in an inference, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>: et deus vester nihil agens; expers virtutis igitur; <cit><quote lang="la">ita ne beatus quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 60</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">itaque (= et ita), crassum (caelum) Thebis, itaque pingues Thebani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25100.18" n="D" level="2"> Introducing a limitation or restriction, <hi rend="ital">on the condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the assumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in so far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such an extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only in so far</hi>, etc., commonly followed by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tamen ita probanda est mansuetudo, ut adhibeatur rei publicae causa severitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax ita convenerat, ut Etruscis Latinisque fluvius Albula finis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:29" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 29</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ante omnia ita vos irae indulgere oportet, ut potiorem irā salutem habeatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 3</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longiorem dicturis periodum colligendus est spiritus, ita tamen ut id neque diu neque cum sono faciamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ita praetereamus, ut tamen intuentes ac respectantes relinquamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 5, 13</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25100.19" n="E" level="2"> To denote degree, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such a degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quid ita placuerit iis, non video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tibi ita mando, ut dubitem an etiam te rogem, ut pugnes ne intercaletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fugavit Samnites, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>; esp. with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices ita fortes tamen fuerunt, ut ... vel perire maluerint, quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sordidus ut se Non umquam servo melius vestiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sunt omnia debilitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">negatives</hi>: non (haud, nec, etc.) ita, <hi rend="ital">not very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not especially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita magna mercede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita lato interjecto mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita antiqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessione utuntur non ita probabili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec nunc enucleare non ita necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita multum provectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post, neque ita multo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pel. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
itaeomelis: <entryFree id="n25101" type="main" key="itaeome_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">itaeomēlis</orth>, <sense id="n25101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a made wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
