italia: <entryFree id="n25102" type="main" key="I_ta^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ītălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for Vitalia from vitulus; cf. <foreign lang="greek">i)talo/s,</foreign> from the abundance and excellence of its cattle; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 1</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n25102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:201" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 13, 77, § 201</bibl> et saep.— In apposition: Italia terra, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25102.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Italy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam Italiam esse effusam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25102.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n25102.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ītălĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 21, 25, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus falcium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de qua (olea) Catonis Italica sententia,</quote> <trans><tr>adapted to the climate of Italy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 19, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>the Social war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagorei, qui essent Italici philosophi quondam nominati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ītălĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Italian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italicus es an provincialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:16:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 16, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25102.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ītălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:84" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:53" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 53</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ītălĭdes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the Italian women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 657</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25102.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ītălus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Italis longe disjungimur oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <trans><tr>the Latin language</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 134</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25102.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n25102.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An Italian</hi>, <number>plur.</number>: Itali <pb n="1007" /> <cb n="ITEM" /> ac Latini, Auct. Har. Resp. 9, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes Italum (Italorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25102.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient king of Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from whom the country is said to have taken its name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 178</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 533</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 127" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 127</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
italica: <entryFree id="n25103" type="main" key="I_^ta^li^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ī^tălĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n25103.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The confederate name of the city of Corfinium during the Marsian war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:16:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 16, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25103.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in</hi> Hispania Baetica, <hi rend="ital">founded by</hi> Scipio Africanus, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the emperors Trajan and Hadrian</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Santiponce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 2</bibl> and 3.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtălĭcenses</orth> <itype>homines</itype>, Auct. B. Alex. 52; and, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtălĭcenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 52" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
itaque: <entryFree id="n25104" type="main" key="i^ta^que"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtă-que</orth>, <sense id="n25104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25104.1" n="I" level="1"> ( = et ita.) <hi rend="ital">And so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and accordingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita dolui, itaque ego nunc doleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cetera ita sunt ut vis, itaque ut esse ego illa existimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quaestor in Sicilia fuissem, itaque ex ea provincia discessissem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita constitui, fortiter esse agendum, itaque feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 19, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nostri acriter in hostes, signo dato, impetum fecerunt, itaque hostes repente celeriterque procurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud tempus exspectandum decreverunt, itaque fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25104.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">And so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for that reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consequently</hi> (for syn. cf. igitur, idcirco, ideo, ergo): <cit><quote lang="la">itaque ipse mea legens, sic adficior interdum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque rem suscipit et a Sequanis impetrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25104.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Occupying the second or third place in the sentence (very rare, and not before the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">versis itaque subito voluntatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">edicimus itaque omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero itaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc itaque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro ingenti itaque victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 54, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 16, 7</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the fourth place: omnium sententiis absolutus itaque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 43</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25104.4" n="B" level="2"> Adding an example or argument, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil opus (est philosophum) litteras scire. Itaque, ut majores nostri ab aratro Cincinnatum abduxerunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes sunt simplices ... itaque aër et ignis et aqua et terra prima sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque hoc frequenter dici solet,</quote> <trans><tr>in like manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25104.5" n="C" level="2"> Itaque ergo, <hi rend="ital">and hence therefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and so for that reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque ergo amantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 2</bibl> Drak.; 3, 31, 5; 39, 25, 11 al.</sense></entryFree>
itatenus: <entryFree id="n25105" type="main" key="i^ta^te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtă-tĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n25105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such a degree</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
item: <entryFree id="n25106" type="main" key="i^tem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>i- (cf. is) and -tam, <hi rend="ital">acc. fem.</hi> corresponding to tum (is), -tud; cf. tam; Sanscr. ittham, so</etym>. <sense id="n25106.0" n="I" level="1"> Implying comparison, <hi rend="ital">just so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the same manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likewise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita, pariter, eodem modo): proinde eri ut sint, ipse item sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia mi item ut parentes lucis das tuendi copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam item a principio rei pepercisses meae, ut nunc repercis saviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit Scaevolae et Coruncanio, itemque ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">item igitur si sine divinatione non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:52:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 52, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fit, ut non item in oratione, ut in versu numerus exstet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti item uti praedones solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">item ... quemadmodum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">54: item ... quasi murteta juncis, item ego vos virgis circumvinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">item ... atque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes vagitu suo paene bis prodidit: semel, cum a nutricis ubere, item cum a sinu matris raptim auferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25106.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: non item, <hi rend="ital">but not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum uni Crasso jucundum, ceteris non item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum offensiones sine culpa accidere possunt, animorum non item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libero servant, in libera non item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25106.2" n="II" level="1"> Introducing something additional, without comparison, <hi rend="ital">likewise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">further</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam, quoque): postquam amans accessit unus et item alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariovistus respondit, jus esse belli, ut, etc.: item populum Romanum victis non ad alterius praescriptum imperare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: legionem <cb n="ITER" /> Caesar constituit ... item equites Ariovisti pari intervallo constiterunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus augur cum fratre item augure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille res in Africa gessit: itemque Mago, ejus frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,023:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Han. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut recessit, sic accessit et abscessit, item, incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. p. 87" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. p. 87</bibl></cit> Müll.; so in enumerating, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>, <hi rend="ital">again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">item ... tertio ... quarto ...,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel ... item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iter: <entryFree id="n25107" type="main" key="i^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭter</orth>, <itype>ĭtĭnĕris</itype> (archaic forms: <case>nom.</case> ĭtĭner, Enn. Pac. Att. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 482, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 339</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 897</bibl>.— <sense id="n25107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> iteris, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 695</bibl> P.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 485, 3</bibl>; Jul. Hyg. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 108</bibl> P.; also, iteneris, Lex Agr., C. I. L. 1, 200, 26.— <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> itere, Att. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 485, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 653</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for itiner, from īre, ĭtum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a going</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">way.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25107.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25107.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam in itinere,</quote> <trans><tr>on the way</tr>, <tr>as we go along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ipsa in itinere dum narrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc quia habebas iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter illi saepius in forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:77" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diversum iter equi concitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n25107.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25107.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A going to a distant place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a journey;</hi> and of an army, <hi rend="ital">a march</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illi iter instaret et subitum et longum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in itinere copia frumenti suppeteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eo itineris causa convenerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo maleficio iter per provinciam facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso itinere confligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 36, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:15:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina ex itinere plerisque consularibus litteras mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere se itineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingredi pedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere pulverulentā viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter mihi est Lanuvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter habere Capuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere in Apuliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:5:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; Salv. Gub. Dei, 1, 9: contendere iter, <hi rend="ital">to hasten one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s journey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">intendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">properare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere,</quote> <trans><tr>to determine upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:520" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 520</bibl></cit>: convertere in aliquem locum, <hi rend="ital">to direct one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s journey to a certain place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 56</bibl>: dirigere ad Mutinam, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere in aliquam partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 715</bibl></cit>: flectere, <hi rend="ital">to change one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convertere,</quote> <trans><tr>to direct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, C; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare,</quote> <trans><tr>to prepare for a journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 2, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supprimere,</quote> <trans><tr>to stop</tr>, <tr>break off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre per medium mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre Inachias urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:326" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuare die ac nocte,</quote> <trans><tr>to march day and night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desistere itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptum dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:232" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 381</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:188" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinere prohibere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex itinere redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">revertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boii ex itinere nostros adgressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutum alicui praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25107.5" n="2" level="3"> Iter terrestre, iter pedestre, <hi rend="ital">a journey by land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a land route</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">iter terrestre facturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde terrestri itinere frumentum advehere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrestri itinere ducere legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 36, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedestri itinere confecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedestri itinere Romam pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 45, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 11, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25107.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A journey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a march</hi>, considered as a measure of distance: cum abessem ab Amano iter unius diei, <hi rend="ital">a day</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s journey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dierum iter quadraginta processerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: quam maximis itineribus potest in Galliam contendit, <hi rend="ital">by making each day</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s journey as long as possible</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forced marches</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis diurnis nocturnisque itineribus contendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera multo majora fugiens quam ego sequens,</quote> <trans><tr>making greater marches in his flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Brut.</author> ad Cic. Fam. 11, 13</bibl></cit>.— Hence, justum iter diei, <hi rend="ital">a day's march of a proper length</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confecto justo itinere ejus diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 76</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25107.7" n="4" level="3"> The place in which one goes, travels, etc., <hi rend="ital">a way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">road</hi>: qua ibant ab itu iter appellarant, Varr. L. <cb n="ITER" /> L. 5, § 35 Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">5, § 22: itineribus deviis proticisci in provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant omnino itinera duo, quibus itineribus domo exire possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedestria itinera concisa aestuariis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefacere alicui iter in aliquem locum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diversum iter equi concitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut deviis itineribus milites duceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinere devio per ignorantiam locorum retardati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum per insidiosa itinera ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua rectum iter in Persidem ducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:13:11:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 13, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fodiendo, substruendo iter facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.— Of the <hi rend="ital">corridors</hi> in houses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl>.—Of any <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter urinae,</quote> <trans><tr>the urethra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17</bibl></cit>: carpere iter, <hi rend="ital">to pursue a journey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rubos fessi pervenimus utpote longum carpentes iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non utile carpis iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 550</bibl></cit>: alicui iter claudere, <hi rend="ital">to block one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close the way</hi> for him: <cit><quote lang="la">ne suus hoc illis clauserit auctor iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 793</bibl>: iter ingredi, <hi rend="ital">to enter on a way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">road</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter patefacere,</quote> <trans><tr>to open a way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25107.8" n="5" level="3"> A privilege or legal right of going to a place, <hi rend="ital">the right of way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquaeductus, haustus, iter, actus a patre sumitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 26, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat se posse iter ulli per provinciam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:7" default="NO">8, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12" default="NO">12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25107.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">method</hi> of a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">patiamur illum ire nostris itineribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum iter gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus naturam suo quodam itinere ad ultimum pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:13:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter amoris nostri et officii mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecit iter sceleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labi per iter declive senectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:227" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae diversum iter ingredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo itinera audendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novis et exquisitis eloquentiae itineribus opus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronum ad honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novum ad principatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iterabilis: <entryFree id="n25108" type="main" key="i^te^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>itero</etym>, <sense id="n25108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be repeated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">injuria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iteratio: <entryFree id="n25109" type="main" key="i^te^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repetition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver borum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 85</bibl></cit>; esp., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">itera tion</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)panafora/,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 533 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et reditus ad propositum, et iteratio (dictorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 53, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectio non cruda, sed multā iteratione mollita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25109.1" n="II" level="1"> Agric. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">arationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:64" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; so, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, of <hi rend="ital">a second ploughing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compluribus iterationibus resolvatur vervactum in pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:9" default="NO">2, 12, 9</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">a second pressing of olives</hi>: plurimum refert non miscere iterationem, multoque minus tertiationem, cum prima pressura; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 50, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25109.2" n="III" level="1"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">a species of manumission granted a second time to one who had already been freed and made a Latin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which he received Roman citizenship</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:35" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iterativum: <entryFree id="n25110" type="main" key="i^te^ra_ti_vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĕrātīvum</orth> <itype>verbum</itype>, i. e. verbum frequentativum, Diom. pp. 335 and 336, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 226</bibl> P.</entryFree>
iterato: <entryFree id="n25111" type="main" key="i^te^ra_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĕrātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. itero <sense id="n25111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
iterduca: <entryFree id="n25112" type="main" key="i^terdu_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭterdūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>iter-duco</etym>, <sense id="n25112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who guides on a journey</hi>, an epithet of Juno, as the goddess who guides the steps of the child into the world, and of the bride to her new home, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
itero: <entryFree id="n25113" type="main" key="i^te^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n25113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to do</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">a second time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repeat</hi> (syn.: duplico, repeto). </sense><sense id="n25113.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae audistis, si eadem hic iterem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 99</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Also pleonastically: bis iterare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 154</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum iterare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itera dum eadem ista mihi, non enim satis intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duplicantur iteranturque verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne jam dicta iteremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe iterando eadem, perculit tandem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor segnius saepe iteratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 37, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <trans><tr>to renew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of games, etc.: quibusdam iteratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Phoebus iteraverit ortus,</quote> <trans><tr>has risen a second time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:199" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiensque puer Eheu dixerat, haec resonis iterabat vocibus Eheu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 496</bibl></cit>: cursus <pb n="1008" /> <cb n="ITHO" /> relictos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <trans><tr>to embark again upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam morte,</quote> <trans><tr>to be restored to life by way of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 55, 56, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to renew</tr>, <tr>send a second time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplicem tenues iterant thoraca catenae,</quote> <trans><tr>double it</tr>, <tr>make it thicker</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:775" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 775</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>to wear twice</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit>: muricibus Tyriis iteratae vellera lanae, <hi rend="ital">dipped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dyed twice</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum,</quote> <trans><tr>to reconstruct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterata vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>repeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25113.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25113.3" n="A" level="2"> In agriculture, <hi rend="ital">to plough a second time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">siccitatibus censeo, quod jam proscissum est, iterare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus diligenter fossione iterandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarrituram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 27, 67, § 254</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 29, 71, § 295</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:60" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 4, 20, § 60</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25113.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rehearse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ubi Telebois ordine iterarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum mea facta itero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: scribere bellum et quae in eo gesta sunt iterare, Sempron. Asell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantare rivos atque truncis Lapsa cavis iterare mella,</quote> <trans><tr>to celebrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic iterat voces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 12</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n25113.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĕrātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a soldier who had been discharged</hi> (honestā missione dimissus) <hi rend="ital">and was again recalled to service</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3463</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25113.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĕrātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once more</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerentibus de persona regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navali proelio iterato congredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:2:6 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 2, 6 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si postea eum iterato reum non fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25114" type="gloss" key="i^te^ro_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĕrō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. iterum <sense id="n25114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
iterum: <entryFree id="n25115" type="main" key="i^te^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĕrum</orth> (collat. form ‡ ĭtĕro, Inscr. ap. Fea Framm. di Fast. Cons. Tav. 10, n. 26), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym><hi rend="ital">acc. sing. n.</hi> of compar. form from pronom. stem i- of is; cf. Sanscr. itara, the other; Hibern. itir</etym>, <sense id="n25115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a second time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anew.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25115.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi rex Agathocles regnator fuit, et iterum Phintias, tertium Liparo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum mihi natus videor, quia te repperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum ille eam rem judicatam judicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Livianae fabulae non satis dignae sunt, quae iterum legantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Flaminius consul iterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Quinctius Pennus, iterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is iterum bellum dare dixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 18</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In enumerations: primo quidem decipi, incommodum est: iterum, stultum: tertio turpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:39:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 39, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.—With other <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, esp. with semel, tertium, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his Aeduos semel atque iterum armis contendisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerium jacere iterum ac tertium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum atque tertium tribuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel iterumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 54</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Repeated: iterum atque iterum spectare,</quote> <trans><tr>again and again</tr>, <tr>repeatedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum atque iterum fragor increpat ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterumque iterumque vocavi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 770</bibl></cit>; 3, 436.— </sense><sense id="n25115.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is iterum sinu effuso bellum dare dixisset,</quote> <trans><tr>having loosed again the fold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pares iterum accusandi caussas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ithaca: <entryFree id="n25116" type="main" key="I^tha^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭthăca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭthăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 41</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iqa/kh,</foreign> <sense id="n25116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ionian Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the kingdom of Ulysses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:196 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 196 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">effugimus scopulos Ithacae, Laërtia regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 272</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25116.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n25116.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭthăcen-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ithacan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 63</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25116.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭthăcēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ithacan</hi>: sedes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Baiæ</hi>, said to have been named after the pilot of Ulysses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:541" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 541</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25116.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭthăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ithaca</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Ulysses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ithacan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me data pensa trahentem matribus ostendens Ithacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeolios Ithacis inclusimus utribus Euros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 7, 60</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭthăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Ithacan</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ulysses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Ithacus velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:257" default="NO">10, 257</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ithome: <entryFree id="n25117" type="main" key="I^tho_me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭthōmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iqw/mh,</foreign> <sense id="n25117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Messenia</hi>,<cb n="ITUR" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 7, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13</bibl>; Stat Th. 4, 179.</sense></entryFree>
ithonaeus: <entryFree id="n25118" type="main" key="I^tho_naeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭthōnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Itone.</entryFree>
ithyphallus: <entryFree id="n25119" type="greek" key="i_thy^phallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īthyphallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)qu/fallos,</foreign> <sense id="n25119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ithyphallus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a piece of wood shaped like the</hi> fascinum, <hi rend="ital">and carried about in the festivals of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 176</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n25119.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Priapus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose symbol was the ithyphallus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:31" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 31</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25119.2" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">īthyphallĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ithyphallic</hi>: carmen, <hi rend="ital">an ithyphallic song</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a poem composed in the measure of the hymns to Priapus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. 1018</bibl> P. Atil. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> p. 2698</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25119.3" n="2" level="3"> The metrum Phalaecium is also sometimes called ithyphallicum, Mar. Vict. p. 2566 P.</sense></entryFree>
itidem: <entryFree id="n25120" type="main" key="i^ti^dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭdem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ita; suffix -dem for diem; cf. pridem, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n25120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the same way.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25120.1" n="I" level="1"> As correl. (cf. item). </sense><sense id="n25120.2" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itidem, uti catapultae solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut filium bonum patri esse oportet, itidem ego sum patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque eas itidem fallam, ut ab illis fallimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">floriferis ut apes in saltibus omnia libant, omnia nos itidem depascimur aurea dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25120.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi piscis, itidem est amator lenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itidem olent, quasi quom una multa jura confudit cocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 46</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25120.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cf.: pariter, una, etiam): illa autem virgo atque altera itidem ancillula, Plaud. Rud. prol. 74: feci ego istaec itidem in adulescentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis similist mihi, Itidem habet petasum ac vestitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube me vinciri ilico, dum istic itidem vinciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantia in suas itidem res, et in communes distributa est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsectum a filio Caelum, vinctum itidem a filio Saturnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 24, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
itiner: <entryFree id="n25121" type="main" key="i^ti^ner"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭner</orth>, v. iter <sense id="n25121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
itinerarium: <entryFree id="n25122" type="main" key="i^ti^ne^ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭnĕrārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. itinerarius, II.</entryFree>
itinerarius: <entryFree id="n25123" type="main" key="i^ti^ne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>iter</etym>, <sense id="n25123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a journey</hi> or <hi rend="ital">march</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itinerary</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <trans><tr>the motion of travelling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25123.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭnĕrārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n25123.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An account of a journey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an itinerary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 6</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n25123.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A signal for marching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinerarium sonare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
itinerator: <entryFree id="n25124" type="main" key="i^ti^ne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭnĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a traveller</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Fort. Mauril. 24.</sense></entryFree>
itineror: <entryFree id="n25125" type="main" key="i^ti^ne^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭnĕror</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>iter</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(doipore/w,</foreign> <sense id="n25125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to travel</hi>, Gloss. Lab.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭnĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a traveller</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 1, § 25</bibl>: Salv. de Gub. Dei, 1, p. 33.</sense></entryFree>
itio: <entryFree id="n25126" type="main" key="i^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eo</etym>, <sense id="n25126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going</hi>, <hi rend="ital">walking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itiones crebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de obviam itione ita faciam, ut suades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeris quod cogitem de obviam itione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditum ac domum itionem dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
itis: <entryFree id="n25127" type="gloss" key="itis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">itis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a Tuscan word meaning <sense id="n25127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">day</hi>, from which Idus is derived, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
itito: <entryFree id="n25128" type="hapax" key="i^ti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n25128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [ito], <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>: exsequias ititant, Naev. ap. Calp. Pis., acc. to Merul. Fragm. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 417</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
itius: <entryFree id="n25129" type="main" key="Itius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Itius</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Iccius</orth>) <itype>Portus</itype>, <sense id="n25129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a port of the Morini</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Belgic Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which Cæsar passed over to Britain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Wissant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Witsand</hi>, a few miles east of <hi rend="ital">Cape Grisnez</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ito: <entryFree id="n25130" type="main" key="i^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n25130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [eo], <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>: ad legionem cum itant. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cenas itare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus itavisse in curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:18:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 24</bibl>; Edict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
itone: <entryFree id="n25131" type="main" key="I^to_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtōnē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ithōnē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Itōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city and mountain in Bœotia</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">Thessaly</hi>), <hi rend="ital">with a temple of Pallas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:720" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 228</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25131.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25131.2" n="A" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ito-nida</orth> (an error for <orth extent="full" lang="la">Itōnis</orth>), <itype>Minerva a loco sic appeliata</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=105" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 105</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n25131.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtōnaei</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ithōn-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabilants of Itone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:330" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 330</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25131.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)itw/nios,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Itonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum Minervae Itoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ituraea: <entryFree id="n25132" type="main" key="I^tu_raea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtūraea</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ityr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n25132.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A district of Cœlesyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of which were celebrated as archers</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">El-Jeidoor</hi>, Vulg. <cb n="IZI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25132.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtūraeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ityr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ituræa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ituræan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 230</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 81</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtū-raei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Ituræans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
itus: <entryFree id="n25133" type="main" key="i^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>eo</etym>, <sense id="n25133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gait.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25133.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec repentis itum cujusviscumque animantis Sentimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 388</bibl></cit>: itum, gestum, amictum qui videbant ejus, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 123, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25133.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25133.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A going away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster itus, reditus, vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro itu ac reditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itum felicem reditumque gloriosum exoptans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25133.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: per paucos itus ac reditus, Pall 7, 2, 4.—</sense><sense id="n25133.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The right of going</hi> anywhere. <hi rend="ital">right of road</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4085 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
itylus: <entryFree id="n25134" type="main" key="I^ty^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/itulos,</foreign> <sense id="n25134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Ze thus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 13</bibl> (where Itylus is confounded with Itys).</sense></entryFree>
ityraeus: <entryFree id="n25135" type="main" key="I^ty_raeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtȳraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Ituraeus.</entryFree>
itys: <entryFree id="n25136" type="main" key="I^tys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭtys</orth>, <itype>Ityos, Ityn or Itym</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/itus.</foreign> <sense id="n25136.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Tereus and Progne; he was killed by his mother and served up to his father for food; whereupon he was changed into a pheasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Progne into a swallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Tereus into an owl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:652 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 652 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25136.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 574</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iuleus: <entryFree id="n25137" type="main" key="I^u_le_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭūlēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Jūl-</orth>), v. Iulus.</entryFree>
iulis: <entryFree id="n25138" type="greek" key="i^u_lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭūlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)ouli/s,</foreign> <sense id="n25138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of rockfish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25139" type="main" key="Iu_lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iūlis</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iouli/s,</foreign> <sense id="n25139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in the island of Ceos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which Simonides and Bacchylides were born</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Zea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iulus: <entryFree id="n25140" type="greek" key="i^u_lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/oulos,</foreign> the <sense id="n25140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">woolly part</hi> of many plants, <hi rend="ital">a catkin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 29, 52, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25141" type="main" key="Iu_lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iūlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>) (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Jūl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ioulos.</foreign> <sense id="n25141.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Ascanius and grandson of Æneas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom the</hi> gens Julia <hi rend="ital">regarded as their ancestor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 583</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 42</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n25141.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭūlēus</orth><itype />, (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Jūl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">named from Iulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Æneas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Iulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Albanus</tr>,</trans> <bibl
