n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:108:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 108, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iūlēi avi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:124" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25141.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Originating from Julius Cæsar.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25141.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to Cæsar and his family</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iuleae Calendae,</quote> <trans><tr>the first of July</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:797" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 797</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iulea carina,</quote> <trans><tr>the fleet of Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 17. —</sense><sense id="n25141.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Imperial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <trans><tr>the garland of olive boughs given by Domitian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:36:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 36, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenae,</quote> <trans><tr>the imperial power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:102:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 102, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25141.5" n="II" level="1"> Jūlus (dissyl.), <hi rend="ital">prænomen of Antonius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of the triumvir M. Antonius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iverna: <entryFree id="n25142" type="main" key="Iverna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iverna</orth>, v. Hibernia.</entryFree>
ixia: <entryFree id="n25143" type="greek" key="ixi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ixĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)ci/a,</foreign> <sense id="n25143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chameleon plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ixion: <entryFree id="n25144" type="main" key="Ixi_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ixīon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ici/wn,</foreign> <sense id="n25144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Phlegyas</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">of Antion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of Jupiter</hi>), <hi rend="ital">king of the Lapithæ in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Pirithoüs. He murdered his father-in-law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to avoid paying the nuptial presents; and as no one would absolve him after such a deed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Jupiter took him into heaven and there purified him. When</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notwithstanding this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he made an attempt on the chastity of Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Jupiter substituted for her an image of cloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with which he begat the Centaurs; but having boasted of his imaginary criminal success with Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Jupiter hurled him into Tartarus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where he was bound fast to an ever-revolving wheel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 465</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 601</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ixione natus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pirithoüs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ixione nati,</quote> <trans><tr>the Centaurs</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:504" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 504</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25144.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n25144.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ixīŏnĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-onĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ixion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ixionei rota orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ixionii amici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25144.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ixīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">son of Ixion</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pirithoüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 38</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ixīŏnĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the Centaurs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 386</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 566</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ixor: <entryFree id="n25145" type="main" key="Ixor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ixor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Gætulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iynx: <entryFree id="n25146" type="greek" key="i^ynx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭynx</orth>, <itype>iyngis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/ugc,</foreign> <sense id="n25146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wryneck</hi>, a bird made use of in conjurations and charms, with which it was thought that slighted lovers could procure a return of affection, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 47, 107, § 256</bibl>; Laev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 294</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
izi: <entryFree id="n25147" type="main" key="Izi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Izi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 64</bibl> Jan. (al. Izzi). <pb n="1009" /> <cb n="JACE" /> <cb n="J." /></sense></entryFree>
j: <entryFree id="n25148" type="main" key="J"><orth extent="full" lang="la">J</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">j</orth>, <itype>a consonant which</itype>, although originally represented by the same character as the vowel <sense id="n25148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i</hi>, was distinguished from it by the ancients themselves, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 1</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 416</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 544</bibl> ib.; Don. p. 1735 ib. al. The old grammarians supposed it to lengthen a preceding vowel (but v. Roby, Gram. 1, § 143). Its pronunciation was like that of the German <hi rend="ital">j</hi> (or Engfish <hi rend="ital">y</hi>) at the beginning of syllables, as jus, injuria, ejectus (Corss.). But where <hi rend="ital">j</hi> occurs as a medial between two vowels, it is, according to the statement of the grammarians, to be pronounced double; <cit><quote lang="la">wherefore, in such cases, it is also written double by many (e. g. by Cicero), as ajjo, Majja, ejjus, pejjus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 545</bibl> P.; Vel. Long. p. 2219 ib. al.; and in inscriptions with a tall <hi rend="ital">I.</hi> The closest relation exists between <hi rend="ital">j</hi> and the vowel <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, and in the course of formation and inflection they are very often interchanged: Pompejus, Pompei; Gajus, Gai; jam, etiam, quoniam; ajo, aibam. By the poets, <hi rend="ital">i</hi> was often hardened into <hi rend="ital">j</hi> to form position: abjete, abjetibus, for abiete, abietibus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:page=1432" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> p. 1432</bibl> P.; Mar. Vict. p. 2474 ib. <hi rend="ital">J</hi> is related to <hi rend="ital">g</hi>, as magis, major. <hi rend="ital">J</hi> arises from <hi rend="ital">dj</hi> or <hi rend="ital">di</hi>, as Juppiter, Jovis, from Djuppiter, Djovis. <hi rend="ital">J</hi> was omitted before another <hi rend="ital">i</hi> in compounds of jacio with monosyllabic prepositions: abicit, adicit, obicit, for abjicit, adjicit, objicit. The preposition is regularly long (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 421</bibl>), but after the time of Ovid is sometimes shortened (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 188</bibl>). A diphthong is sometimes formed with the preceding vowel: r??cĕ (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 96</bibl>), ??cĭt (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 890</bibl>). As an abbreviation, J. O. M. signifies Jovi Optimo Maximo; J. R. Juno Regina; J. V. T. Julia Victrix Togata.</sense></entryFree>
jabolenus: <entryFree id="n25149" type="main" key="Ja^bo^le_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jăbŏlēnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Javol-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman jurist in the time of Trajan, Hadrian, and Antoninus Pius</hi>, Capit. Anton. 12.</sense></entryFree>
jacea: <entryFree id="n25150" type="main" key="jacea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jacea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wooden hay-rack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cratis, quae jacea vocatur a vulgo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56, 5</bibl></cit> (dub. al jacca).</sense></entryFree>
jaceo: <entryFree id="n25151" type="main" key="ja^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, cĭtum</itype> (<sense id="n25151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. part.</hi> jaci-turus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:777" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 777</bibl>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym><hi rend="ital">intr.</hi> of jacio; lit., to be thrown or cast; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lie</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25151.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25151.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in limine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratum ad pedes alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui ad pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:269" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 269</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ignota harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 871</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrio sublimis in ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in viridi gramine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in teneris dominae lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:13:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in viduo toro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gremio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 136</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 4: in servi complexibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:279" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 279</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: saxum campo quod forte jacebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:897" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 897</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserto lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gremio mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aversa ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super corpus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:836" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spissa harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus humi jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 224</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi ante lectum jacens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mecum inter salices lenta sub vite jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub alta platano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strata jacent sub arbore poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 54</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tityos jacet alitis esca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vittae jacentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces jacentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>flatfish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25151.4" n="1" level="3"> Of sick persons, <hi rend="ital">to lie ill, to be sick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura ut valeas, ne ego te jacente bona tua comedim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tristj morbo defessa jaceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic facit ut jaceas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5</bibl></cit>. 9: <cit><quote lang="la">sine spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lie dead, to have fallen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeacidae telo jacet Hector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 737</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora per campos ferro quae fusa jacebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primi occidissent, proximi jacentibus insisterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 25, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem jacentem veste spoliavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia jacentis hostium exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne inultos imperatores suos jacere sinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui bene pro patria cum patriaque jacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arge, jaces!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 720</bibl></cit>: morte jacent merita, id. <cb n="JACE" /> F. 3, 707: <cit><quote lang="la">fratri jacet,</quote> <trans><tr>killed by his brother</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:650" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupto jacuit corpore (rana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacuit Catilina cadavere toto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:288" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 288</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lie long</hi> anywhere, <hi rend="ital">to linger, tarry, stop</hi> at a place: <cit><quote lang="la">pernam, glandium, sumen facito in aqua jaceant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brundusii,</quote> <trans><tr>to stay long at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.7" n="4" level="3"> Geographically, <hi rend="ital">to lie, be situate</hi>, = esse, situm esse (not in Cic. or Cæs.): jacet Vada inter Appenninum et Alpis, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 30, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Taurum montem jacet et Hellespontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 2</bibl></cit> saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae gens jacet supra Ciliciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vesperam jacentis terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo in vertice montis Planities ignota jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod urbes in planis jaceant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio patriam quaerunt sub sole jacentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacet extra sidera tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 795</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pallente sub umbra Cimmerias jacuisse domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:132" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter eos solemque jacent immania ponti aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 412</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyclades et Sporades per quingenta milia in longitudinem ... jacent,</quote> <trans><tr>extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be low, flat, level</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacentia et plana urbis loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">despiciens terras jacentīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetervehor Thapsum jacentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 689</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:712" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 712</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque jacent valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:392" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 392</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacentes campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo despexit ab aethere terras Infelix Phaëthon penitus penitusque jacentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 178</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.9" n="6" level="3"> Esp., of the sea, <hi rend="ital">to be level, quiet, lie still</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediusque jacet sine murmure pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 260</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:434" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 434</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servatum bello jacuit mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna jacentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:583" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 583</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.10" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lie in ruins, be broken down</hi>: cui nec arae patriae domi stant, fractae et disjectae jacent, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 115 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">jacent, Ilion ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausa et jacentem visere regiam vultu sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troja jacet certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus Thebe jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:6" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.11" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hang loose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagi crines per colla jacebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 673</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 236</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacentia lora,</quote> <trans><tr>lying loose on the horse's neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 201</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of clothing, etc.: juvenes timidaeque puellae Praeverrunt latas veste jacente vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissa jacent tibi pallia terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 153</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25151.12" n="9" level="3"> Of the eyes, face, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be cast down, fixed on the ground</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultusque attolle jacentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacentes Vix oculos tollens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:618" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 618</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n25151.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25151.14" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be indolent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inactive, not to come forward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pace jacere, quam in bello vigere maluit. Quamquam ille quidem numquam jacuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Marius cum a spe consulatus longe abesset et jam septimum annum post praeturam jaceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars tua, Tiphy, jacet, si non sit in aequore fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at mea numina tandem fessa jacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 298</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be cast down, dejected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gnaeus noster ut totus jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne jaceam? quis unquam minus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacet in maerore meus frater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum jacere animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.16" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lie prostrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victa jacet pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas sub amore jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africani, Marii, Sullae, Pompeii infra Pallantis laudes jacebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia vacillat, vel jacet potius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana cum vita jaceret, oppressa gravi sub religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.17" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be refuted, overcome, disproved, to fail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacent suis testibus, qui Clodium negant Romam fuisse rediturum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacet omnis ratio Peripateticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacet igitur tota conclusio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:51:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 51, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.18" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lie dormant, be disused</hi> or <hi rend="ital">neglected, to be of no avail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum leges nihil valebant, cum judicia jacebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota Capua et omnis hic delectus jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: dici non potest, quomodo hic omnia jaceant, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximas virtutes jacere omnes necesse est voluptate dominante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.19" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be despised, in no esteem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jacerent pretia praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque jacere regem pateremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nunc omnia ista jacere puto, propter nummorum caritatem,</quote> <trans><tr>are cheap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: dat census honores, <cb n="JACT" /> Census amicitias: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper ubique jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:218" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,005:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> R. Am 139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.20" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lie idle, neglected</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">unemployed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur tamdiu jacet hoc nomen in adversariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo tibi tanta pecunia extraordinaria jacet?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (pecuniae) vereor, ne otiosae jaceant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 62, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne justius erit proximo cuique bonorum possessionem dari, ne bona jaceant,</quote> <trans><tr>that they be not without an owner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.21" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lie open, be obvious, to be known, be at hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ex alio genere (verborum) ad usum cottidianum, alio ad scenam pompamque sumuntur, sed ea nos cum jacentia sustulimus e medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25151.22" n="I" level="1"> Of speech or language, <hi rend="ital">to be languid, lifeless, dull</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus detractis, jacet (oratio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacens oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jacetani: <entryFree id="n25152" type="main" key="Ja^ce^ta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jăcĕtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in northern Spain, at the foot of the Pyrenees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jacio: <entryFree id="n25153" type="main" key="ja^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcĭo</orth>, <itype>jēci, jactum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">diw/kw</foreign>, to pursue; Germ. jagen</etym>, to make go, cause to go, send; hence, <sense id="n25153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw, cast, fling, hurl.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25153.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: genu ad aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to hit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">push one with the knee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen in medium mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quem scyphum de manu jacere conatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aridam materiam de muro in aggerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in profundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxeam pilam ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem fluctibus mediis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balearica plumbum Funda jacit, Ov M. 2, 728: libellos in faciem ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Freq. of dice-throwing: <cit><quote lang="la">talos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25153.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25153.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay, set, establish, build, found, construct, erect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbi fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggere jacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 631</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 712</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novae domus fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:835" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 835</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25153.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To send forth, emit; to bring forth, produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de corpore odorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 846</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igniculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacturas poma myricas,</quote> <trans><tr>that will bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 747</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25153.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta jacere, fugereque hostes, more habent licentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is sua jecit humi arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidas pharetras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:427" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 427</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to throw overboard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:21:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 21, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:2:section=7" default="NO">14, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">to cast, shed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25153.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw, scatter, sow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres semina jacta legunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 485</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacto semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminibus jactis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 57</bibl></cit>; 6, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 662</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25153.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To project</hi> as a shadow: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:183 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 183 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n25153.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25153.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To throw, cast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulteria,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay to one's charge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, quod proponendum fuit, permotis animis jacit ad extremum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 13, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecit quidam casus caput meum, in mediam contentionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probra in feminas illustres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25153.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay, set, establish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae fundamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum atque aditum ad rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia in longum jacere,</quote> <trans><tr>to strew, sow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25153.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To throw out in speaking, to let fall, intimate, utter, mention, declare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduas querelas, Cic. poët. Div 1, 8, 14: illud, quod jacis obscure,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de lacu Albano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera an vana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo plura praesens audivit, quam in absentem jacta erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtha inter alias jacit oportere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam de habitu cultuque et institutis ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> A 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuitos sermones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ali quid per vaniloquentiam ac minas, id. ib 6, 31: multasque nec dubias significationes saepe jecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina non haec sunt nostro sine jacta dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:14:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jactabilis: <entryFree id="n25154" type="main" key="jacta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>jacto</etym>, <sense id="n25154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be thrown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jactabundus: <entryFree id="n25155" type="main" key="jacta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tossing to and fro, agitated, stormy</hi> (post-class) </sense><sense id="n25155.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25155.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> <pb n="1010" /> <cb n="JACT" /> <hi rend="ital">boasting, vaunting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in Graecae facundiae gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jactans: <entryFree id="n25156" type="main" key="jactans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from jacto.</entryFree>
jactanter: <entryFree id="n25157" type="main" key="jactanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. jacto <sense id="n25157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
jactantia: <entryFree id="n25158" type="main" key="jactanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jacto</etym>, <sense id="n25158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boasting, bragging; display, ostentation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frivola in parvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:74" default="NO">9, 2, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim jactantia ingenii, ut res cito accepisse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatae studere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 38, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jactanticulus: <entryFree id="n25159" type="main" key="jactanti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactantĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n25159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [jactans], <hi rend="ital">somewhat boasting</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:adv. Ac. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> adv. Ac. 3, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jactantĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a braggart; plur.</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jactatio: <entryFree id="n25160" type="main" key="jacta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jacto</etym>, <sense id="n25160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tossing to and fro, a shaking, agitation, violent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frequent motion</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25160.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>motion, gestures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum ducta cicatrix, patique posse visa jactationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a storm at sea: ex magna jactatione terram videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armigeri in castra referebant (eum) jactationem vulnerum haud facile tolerantem,</quote> <trans><tr>the jolting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25160.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25160.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of mental <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactationes animorum incitatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25160.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n25160.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A boasting, bragging; ostentation, display, vanity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatio est voluptas gestiens et se efferens insolentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: verborum, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla cultūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extemporalis garrulitas circulatoriae jactationis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: nonnullorum hominum jactationem et insolentiam ferre non potes, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl>, A, 5.—</sense><sense id="n25160.6" n="2" level="3"> Jactatio popularis, <hi rend="ital">a striving after popular applause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 35, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:20:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 20, 43</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jactatio cursusque popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia haec forensis ... ornata verbis atque sententiis jactationem habuit in populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jactator: <entryFree id="n25161" type="main" key="jacta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes an ostentatious display of himself, a boaster, braggart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum a se gestarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:837" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 837</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille sub hiberno somnos educere caelo Jactator,</quote> <trans><tr>he boasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:403" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 403</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jactatrix: <entryFree id="n25162" type="main" key="jacta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jactator</etym>, <sense id="n25162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that boasts</hi>, Sidon.</sense></entryFree>
jactatus: <entryFree id="n25163" type="main" key="jacta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>jacto</etym>, <sense id="n25163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing to and fro, a tossing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:99" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 32, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodlibet quassum vas et quolibet fragile jactatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jactitabundus: <entryFree id="n25164" type="main" key="jacti^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jactito</etym>, <sense id="n25164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boasting, bragging</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
jactito: <entryFree id="n25165" type="main" key="jacti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>jacto</etym>, <sense id="n25165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring forward in public, to utter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicula intexta versibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">come officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jacto: <entryFree id="n25166" type="main" key="jacto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jacto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (jactarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 556</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Tr. 130</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>jacio</etym>, <sense id="n25166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw, cast, hurl.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25166.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <trans><tr>to scatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina per undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 748</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactato flore tegente vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrita sacrilega jactas incendia dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem argentumque de muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides vacuum in orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinerem per agros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se muris in praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of casting a net: rete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also of dicethrowing: talos arripio, jacto basilicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosque manu jactabat eburnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 203</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:355" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 355</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25166.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toss about; to shake, flourish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:991" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 991</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachia in numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:179" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:21" default="NO">10, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tinnula manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tintinnabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerosa pallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:236" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerviculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:19:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 19, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi se suo more jactavisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make gestures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multum se Curio ex more jactasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:129" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultare immoderateque jactari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in suo sanguine,</quote> <trans><tr>to wallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videntes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a facie manus,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw kisses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:106" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 106</bibl></cit>; cf.: jactare<cb n="JACT" />  basia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be restless, rebellious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drive hither and thither, to drive about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adversā tempestate in alto jactarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 235</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Aeneas pelago ... omnia circum Litora jactetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 668</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactati aequore toto Troes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:441 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 441 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando, ut fit, jactor in turba, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatur domi suae homo honestissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestu febrique jactari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—So of the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jactetur aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito mutata est jactati forma profundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to throw overboard, throw into the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:43:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 43, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:4:section=2" default="NO">14, 2, 4, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatur rerum utilium pars maxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw out, emit, spread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna suam jactat de corpore lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces per umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 768</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25166.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To torment, disquiet, disturb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactor, crucior, agitor, stimulor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo te jactari diutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa velut navis jactor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactari morbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore et convicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.9" n="B" level="2"> Jactare se or jactari, <hi rend="ital">not to be firm, to waver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 10</bibl>.—Of money, <hi rend="ital">to fluctuate in value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactabatur temporibus illis nummus sic, ut nemo posset scire, quid haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25166.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To consider, examine, discuss</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluribus praesentibus eas res jactari nolebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa totā die in concilio variis jactata sermonibus erant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>discussed, not decided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectore curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactari magis quam peragi accusatio ejus poterat,</quote> <trans><tr>discussed without a conclusion, to no purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To discuss, mention, intimate, pronounce, throw out, utter, speak, say, name, propose</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">rem jactare sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro citroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactamus jam pridem omnis te Roma beatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia jactanti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatum in condicionibus nequiquam de Tarquiniis in regnum restituendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc autem jactari magis causam quam veram esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be rather the pretext than the true reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.12" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fling out</hi> threats, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">jactare et opponere terrorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:23:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 23, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probra in quempiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">convicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.13" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To boast of, vaunt</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentare honorem aetatis, jactare urbanam gratiam et dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus et nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna et virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo te jactas creatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.14" n="G" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">se, to talk boastfully of one's self, to boast, make an ostentatious display</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25166.15" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerantius se jactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:section=209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 52, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non jactandi mei causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 268" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 268</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to boast of one's self to a person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Iliae querenti ultorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse cum se jactaret amicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.17" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in eo se in contione jactavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis sit lucus, quo se plus jactet Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.18" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactat se jamdudum de Calidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 46</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se justitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 23, 34</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">two acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se jactare formosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.19" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry one's self confidently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conceitedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui antea solitus esset jactare se magnificentissime in illo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.20" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be officious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">active in, to give one's self up to, devote one's self to</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">jactare se in causis centumviralibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum hoc tempus aetatis forensi labore jactari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (re publica) tu non valde te jactas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se actionibus tribuniciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.21" n="K" level="1"> Se in pecuniis, <hi rend="ital">to be prodigal of one's money</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">jactans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., boasting, bragging, boastful, vainglorious</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25166.22" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: insolens, arrogans, jactans, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 322, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae jactantes et gloriosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vereor ne jactantior videar, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 815</bibl>: jactantior hic paulo est, <cb n="JACU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 50</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidus ae sui jactans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebis jactantissimus amator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25166.23" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">proud, noble, splendid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septemgemino jactantior aethera pulset Roma jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jactanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">boastfully, ostentatiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae jactanter sonantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 170</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactantius maerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jactura: <entryFree id="n25167" type="main" key="jactu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jacto</etym>, <sense id="n25167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing, a throwing away</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25167.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a throwing overboard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in mari jactura facienda sit, equine pretiosi potius jacturam faciat, an servuli vilis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernator, ubi naufragium timet, jactura, quidquid servari potest, redimit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:2:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 2, 2, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25167.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25167.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Loss, damage, detriment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nullam praeterquam vitae jacturam fieri viderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
