G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua jactura facienda sit in repraesentando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jacturae rei familiaris erunt faciendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacturas afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacturam pati, id. praef. l. l.: sarcinarum potius quam disciplinae facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit ordinis retinendi causa facienda jactura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacturam gravissimam feci, si jactura dicenda est tanti viri amissio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of men: <cit><quote lang="la">seniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcri,</quote> <trans><tr>want of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 646</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25167.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Expense, cost</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia sumptibus et jacturis exhausta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non magnā jacturā factā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis jacturis sibi quorundam animos conciliare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos ad se magnis jacturis pollicitationibusque perduxerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25167.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dismissal, turning away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25167.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">loss</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diminution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedam hoc ipsum, si vis, etsi magnam jacturam causae fecero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis jacturam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacturam criminum facere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to omit in the accusation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacturam honoris et dignitatis facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvā jacturā acceptā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla Sophocleo veniet jactura cothurno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 253</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humani generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:91" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jacturalis: <entryFree id="n25168" type="gloss" key="jactu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactūrālis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">e)pizh/mios</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
jacturarius: <entryFree id="n25169" type="gloss" key="jactu_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>qui frequenter jacturam patitur</itype>, Gloss. Isid.</entryFree>
jactus: <entryFree id="n25170" type="main" key="jactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from jacio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25171" type="main" key="jactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>jacio</etym>, <sense id="n25171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing, casting, hurling; a throw, cast</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25171.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25171.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">jactus fulminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec certamina tanta Pulveris exigui jactu compressa quiescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebarum et testarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra jactum teli progressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teli jactu abesse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be a spear's-throw distant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad jactum tali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">truces in sublime jactus (of the bull),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25171.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast</hi> of dice: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est tam incertum quam talorum jactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in prospero tesserarum jactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talorum ducere jactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita vita'st hominum quasi si ludas tesseris: si illud, quod maxime opus't jactu non cadit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25171.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25171.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A throwing out, spreading</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactus radiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25171.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A throwing down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out, throwing overboard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactum mercium facere levandae navis causā,</quote> <trans><tr>a jettison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 2, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere jactum medio in ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1037" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1037</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribilis de saxo jactu' deorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1016" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1016</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 528</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">decidere jactu cum ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25171.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A cast</hi> (of the net), <hi rend="ital">a haul, draught</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactum retis emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:11:section=18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 11, § 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—* </sense><sense id="n25171.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a throwing out, uttering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuitus jactus vocis,</quote> <trans><tr>an assertion casually thrown out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25172" type="main" key="Jactus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jactus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river flowing into the Po</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jaculabilis: <entryFree id="n25173" type="main" key="ja^cu^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jaculor</etym>, <sense id="n25173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be thrown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:658" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 658</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jaculamentum: <entryFree id="n25174" type="hapax" key="ja^cu^la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a missive weapon, missile</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 556, 24</bibl>. <pb n="1011" /> <cb n="JAM" /></sense></entryFree>
jaculatio: <entryFree id="n25175" type="main" key="ja^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jaculor</etym>, <sense id="n25175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing, casting, hurling</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25175.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminatio est jaculatio cum ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 65, § 162</bibl></cit>: fulgoris, App. de Mundo, p. 64, 22.—</sense><sense id="n25175.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac veluti jaculatione verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jaculator: <entryFree id="n25176" type="main" key="ja^cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thrower, caster, hurler</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25176.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Enceladus jaculator audax (truncorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:562" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 562</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">missis a rege Boccho jaculatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 13:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25176.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25176.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A thrower of the dart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">javelin</hi> (a sort of light-armed soldier, who carried only a dart or javelin): <cit><quote lang="la">jaculatorum manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 21 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n25176.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A caster of the net, a fisherman</hi>, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25176.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an accuser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix orator quoque maximus et jaculator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:193" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 193</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jaculatorius: <entryFree id="n25177" type="main" key="ja^cu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jaculator</etym>, <sense id="n25177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for throwing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shooting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <trans><tr>where the exercise of throwing the javelin is practised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jaculatrix: <entryFree id="n25178" type="main" key="ja^cu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that hurls; the huntress</hi>, an epithet of Diana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 375</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jaculatus: <entryFree id="n25179" type="main" key="ja^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>jaculor</etym>, <sense id="n25179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing, hurling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jaculo: <entryFree id="n25180" type="main" key="ja^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlo</orth>, <itype>active form of the following</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 7416</bibl> <foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>; Ven. Fort. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:139" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 18, 7, 8</bibl>.—<sense id="n25180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 568</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jaculor: <entryFree id="n25181" type="main" key="ja^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n25181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> jacularier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 16</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>jaculum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to throw, cast, hurl.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25181.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25181.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jaculum emittit jaculari dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jaculando brachia reducimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duros jaculatur Juppiter imbres, Col. poët. 10, 329: se in hostium tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quas partes se jaculetur cometes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppibus ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidum e nubibus ignem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25181.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25181.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw the javelin, fight with the javelin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem consequi, equitando, jaculando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum diem jaculans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in latus dextrum, quod patebat, Numidae jacularentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:9:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 9, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25181.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw out, emit, spread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi lupo splendent, lucemque jaculantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 10, 15, § 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25181.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurl at, to strike, hit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervos jaculari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextera sacras jaculatus arces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ferro acuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra disco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:589" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter igne suo lucos jaculatur et arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25181.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shoot at, assail, revile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias vibrantes digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:120" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta in calvos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:109:8" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 109, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probris procacibus jaculari, in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 54, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in uxorem obliquis sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25181.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To aim at, strive for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid brevi fortes jaculamur aevo Multa?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25181.9" n="C" level="2"> (Eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">To utter rapidly, to ejaculate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 121" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 121</bibl> (130), 10, 20.</sense></entryFree>
jaculum: <entryFree id="n25182" type="main" key="ja^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>jaculus</etym>. <sense id="n25182.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dart, javelin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem prae jaculorum multitudine et sagittarum non videbitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum jaculo traicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has (litteras) ille in jaculo illigatas affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:124" default="NO">8, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25182.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radiorum solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, § 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25182.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A net</hi>, v. jaculus.</sense></entryFree>
jaculus: <entryFree id="n25183" type="main" key="ja^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jacio</etym>, <sense id="n25183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is thrown</hi> (mostly subst.). So, rete jaculum and simply jaculum, <hi rend="ital">a casting-net, fishingnet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 86</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hi jaculo pisces, illi capiuntur ab hamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 763</bibl></cit>.—Also of the <hi rend="ital">net</hi> of the gladiator retiarius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 54</bibl>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jăcùlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n25183.1" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. serpens.) <hi rend="ital">A serpent that darts from a tree on its prey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculi volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 720</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:822" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 822</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25183.2" n="B" level="2"> Jaculus (sc. funis or laqueus), <hi rend="ital">a sling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noose which is thrown over the horns of oxen, a lasso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl> (al. laquei).</sense></entryFree>
jam: <entryFree id="n25184" type="main" key="jam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for diam, collat. form of diem, cf. pri-dem, du-dum, Corss. Ausspr. I. p. 213; II. p. 850; but acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. 398:620" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. 398, 620</bibl>; locat. form from pronom. stem ja</etym>. <sense id="n25184.0" n="I" level="1"> Of time, denoting a point or moment of time as coinciding with that of the action, etc., described. </sense><sense id="n25184.1" n="A" level="2"> Of present time. </sense><sense id="n25184.2" n="1" level="3"> As <cb n="JAM" /> opp. to past or future, <hi rend="ital">at this time, now, just now, at present</hi>, i. e. while I speak or write this. </sense><sense id="n25184.3" n="a" level="4"> Jam alone: <cit><quote lang="la">jamne autem, ut soles, deludis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam satis credis sobrium esse me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus reficit jam roscida luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tenebris et sole cadente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque dies, ni fallor, adest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam advesperascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere qui voces jam scit puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 158</bibl></cit>: stabat modo consularis, modo septemvir epulonum; <cit><quote lang="la">jam neutrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam melior, jam, diva, precor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hem, scio jam quod vis dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea (consuetudine) quaedam sunt jura ipsa jam certa propter vetustatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tempus agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgere jam tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.4" n="b" level="4"> Strengthened. </sense><sense id="n25184.5" n="(a)" level="5"> By repetition: jam jam, jam jamque (nearly = nunc), <hi rend="ital">at this very time, precisely now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam jam intellego, Crasse, quod dicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam jam minime miror te otium perturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam jam dolet quod egi, jam jamque paenitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam jam linquo acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:875" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 875</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam jamque video bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at illum ruere nuntiant et jam jamque adesse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam mihi, jam possim contentus vivere parvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit> (7).—</sense><sense id="n25184.6" n="(b)" level="5"> By nunc: jam nunc, <hi rend="ital">just now, at this very time, as things now are</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nunc irata non es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux, jam nunc locatus in urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum cogito, jam nunc timeo quidnam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberationis ejus tempus ita jam nunc statui posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa Venus laetos jam nunc migravit in agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam nunc regina loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:47" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 47</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nunc jam (nunciam): secede huc nunciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audi nunciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i nunciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: nunc jam sum expeditus, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc jam nobis vobisque consulatus patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.7" n="(g)" level="5"> By tum: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tum opifices funguntur munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 21, 24, § 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 405</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.8" n="(d)" level="5"> By pridem, v. jampridem.—</sense><sense id="n25184.9" n="2" level="3"> In contrast with the time at which something was expected. </sense><sense id="n25184.10" n="a" level="4"> Of that which occurs sooner, <hi rend="ital">already, so soon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies (animos) aut jam exhaustos aut mox exhauriendos, renovavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitate valetudinis, qua tamen jam paululum videor levari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamne ibis,</quote> <trans><tr>are you going so soon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.11" n="b" level="4"> Of that which occurs later, <hi rend="ital">at last, now, only now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ohe jam desine deos uxor gratulando obtundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulo, Dave, ut redeat jam in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque sero diei subducit ex acie legionem faciendis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sanguinis alti vis sibi fecit iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 214</bibl></cit>.—Tandem or aliquando is often added: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tandem ades ilico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putamus enim utile esse te aliquando jam rem transigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tandem Italiae fugientis prendimus oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.12" n="3" level="3"> As continued from the past, <hi rend="ital">already, by this time, ere now, till now, hitherto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et apud Graecos quidem jam anni prope quadrigenti sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsolevit jam ista oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum feminam aequavimus gloriā, et jam nos laudis satietas cepit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 23</bibl></cit>.—With numerals and words specifying time: <cit><quote lang="la">jam biennium est, cum mecum coepit rem gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">plus jam anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt duo menses jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui septingentos jam annos vivunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum jam tertium et vicesimum regnat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.13" n="4" level="3"> With imperatives, to express haste or impatience, like Engl. now, <hi rend="ital">now, straightway, at once</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid miserum, Aenea, laceras? Jam parce sepulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam age, carpe viam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et jam tu ... illum adspice contra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 373</bibl></cit>.—So in impetuous or passionate questions (freq. in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">Jam tu autem nobis praeturam geris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.14" n="5" level="3"> Jam ... jam, <hi rend="ital">at one time ... at another, now ... now, at this time ... at that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque eadem digitis jam pectine pulsat eburno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque hos cursu, jam praeterit illos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="JAM" /> 157: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jam contento, jam laxo fune laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam vino quaerens, jam somno fallere curas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam secundae, jam adversae res, ita erudierant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 111</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.15" n="B" level="2"> Of past time. </sense><sense id="n25184.16" n="1" level="3"> In the time just past, <hi rend="ital">but now, a moment ago, a little while ago, just</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videamus nunc quam sint praeclare illa his, quae jam posui, consequentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arsinoë et jam dicta Memphis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 11, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae praeter jam dictas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems jam praecipitaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum quam tu jam exaedificatam habebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.17" n="2" level="3"> Like English now, <hi rend="ital">by this time, already</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25184.18" n="a" level="4"> Alone: <cit><quote lang="la">jam advesperascebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem movisse ex hibernis, et jam Alpes transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et jam fama volans ... domos et moenia complet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 582</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque rubescebat Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 521</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 260</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel inclinavit pugna, jam intolerabilis Romana vis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decimum jam diem graviter ex intestinis laborarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.19" n="b" level="4"> Strengthened. </sense><sense id="n25184.20" n="(a)" level="5"> Jam jamque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 708</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.21" n="(b)" level="5"> By tum, <hi rend="ital">as early as that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se jam tum gessisse pro cive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> 7, 738</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.22" n="(g)" level="5"> By tunc (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">once in Cic.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 3</bibl> dub.—</sense><sense id="n25184.23" n="3" level="3"> Of a time succeeding another time referred to, <hi rend="ital">from that time, thenceforth, thereafter</hi> (esp. with <hi rend="ital">a</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, when it is often = Eng. <hi rend="ital">even, very</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">qui aequom esse censent nos jam a pueris nasci senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me maxime sicuti jam a prima adolescentia delectarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentia quae mihi jam a pueritia tua cognita est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dederas enim jam ab adolescentia documenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: jam ab illo tempore, cum, etc., <hi rend="ital">from the very time when</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urgerent philosophorum greges jam ab illo fonte et capite Socrate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>. —So with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ex quo ipse accepisset regnum,</quote> <trans><tr>ever since</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.24" n="C" level="2"> Of future time. </sense><sense id="n25184.25" n="1" level="3"> In the time immediately approaching, <hi rend="ital">forthwith, straightway, directly, presently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occlude sis fores ambobus pessulis: jam ego hic ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille jam hic aderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: omitte; <cit><quote lang="la">jam adero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 38</bibl>: bono animo es; <cit><quote lang="la">jam argentum ad eam deferes, quod ei es pollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere id ut paratum jam sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam fuerit, neque post unquam revocare licebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 927</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam faciam quod voltis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam enim aderunt consules ad suas Nonas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25184.26" n="2" level="3"> In the time immediately succeeding another time referred to, <hi rend="ital">forthwith, at once, straightway, then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ubi me illic non videbit, jam huc recurret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accede ad ignem ... jam calesces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi puerum tollis, jam ego hunc in mediam viam provolvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quibus jam dicendi locus erit, cum de senioribus pauca dixero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agedum, dictatorem creemus. Jam hic centicescet furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperi, inquit, jam scies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 272</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25184.27" n="3" level="3"> Representing as present an impending event, <hi rend="ital">now, already, presently</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">jam te premet nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam veniet mors, jam subrepet iners aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:70" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam mare turbari trabibus videbis, jam fervere litora flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 566</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 676</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius Latio jam partus Achilles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic magnae jam locus urbis erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.28" n="D" level="2"> With negatives, denoting cessation of previous condition: jam non, <hi rend="ital">no more, no longer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem odisse jam non potestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 382</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non jam,</quote> <trans><tr>not any more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25184.29" n="E" level="2"> With comparatives: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mitiora jam ingenia,</quote> <trans><tr>which had become milder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27</bibl></cit>. 39: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ferociores jam gentes,</quote> <trans><tr>which then were less civilized</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una jam potior sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:368" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 368</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n25184.30" n="II" level="1"> In other relations. </sense><sense id="n25184.31" n="A" level="2"> To denote that something will certainly, properly, or easily occur, under certain circumstances. </sense><sense id="n25184.32" n="1" level="3"> In a conclusion, to emphasize its relation to the condition, <hi rend="ital">then surely, then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cogites, remittas jam me onerare injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: si quis voluerit animi sui <pb n="1012" /> <cb n="JAM" /> notionem evolvere, jam se ipse doceat, eum virum bonum esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc dixissem, jam mihi consuli jure optimo senatus vim intulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si jubeat eo dirigi, jam in portu fore omnem classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.33" n="2" level="3"> In a consequence, to show that it is conceived as immediate, <hi rend="ital">now, then, therefore</hi>: satis est tibi in te, satis in legibus; <cit><quote lang="la">jam contemni non poteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hoc non potest in te non honorifice esse dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec hanc solam Romani meretricem colunt ... Jam quanta ista immortalitas putanda est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae cum ita sint, ego jam hinc praedico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 36, 14</bibl></cit>: conspecta et ex muris ea multitudo erat; <cit><quote lang="la">jamque etiam legionariae cohortes sequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 43, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.34" n="B" level="2"> In transitions. </sense><sense id="n25184.35" n="1" level="3"> To a new subject, <hi rend="ital">now, moreover, again, once more then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam de artificiis et quaestibus ... haec fere accepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam jura legitima ex legibus cognosci oportebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam illud senatus consultum, quod eo die factum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam Saliare Numae carmen qui laudat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 86</bibl></cit>. —So with <hi rend="ital">vero</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam vero motus animi, sollicitudines aegritudinesque oblivione leniuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam vero virtuti Cn. Pompei quae potest par oratio inveniri?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 11, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">at enim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at enim jam dicetis virtutem non posse constitui, si ea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:15:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 40 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n25184.36" n="2" level="3"> In enumerations: <cit><quote lang="la">et aures ... itemque nares ... jam gustatus ... tactus autem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>.—So sometimes repeatedly, <hi rend="ital">at one time ... at another ... at another</hi>, jam ... jam ... jam: <cit><quote lang="la">jam medici, jam apparatus cibi, jam in hoc solum importatum instrumentum balinei nullius non succurrit valetudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 8</bibl>, and I. A. 5. supra.—</sense><sense id="n25184.37" n="C" level="2"> For emphasis. </sense><sense id="n25184.38" n="1" level="3"> After non modo ... sed ( = adeo), <hi rend="ital">now, even, I may say</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cum senatu modo, sed jam cum diis bellum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.39" n="2" level="3"> Pressing the strict sense of a word or clause, <hi rend="ital">now, precisely, indeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hieronymum) quem jam cur Peripateticum appellem, nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quidem haud molestum est jam, quod collus collari caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquor enim jam non de sapientium, sed de communibus amicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quoque jam, Thais, ita me di bene ament, amo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitatio morum alienorum ... jam inter leniores affectus numerari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua jam aequitatis sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera jam fabulosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desine: jam venio moriturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:881" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 881</bibl></cit>.—So esp. with <hi rend="ital">et</hi>: et jam (cf. etiam), <hi rend="ital">and indeed, and in fact</hi>, et lenitas illa Graecorum et verborum comprehensio, et jam artifex, ut ita dicam, stilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 25, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchriora etiam Polycleti et jam plane perfecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium et hortari et orare et jam liberius accusare non desistimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 659</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">jamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jam et: nec deerat Ptolemaeus, jam et sceleris instinctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, ac jam: ac jam, ut omnia contra opinionem acciderent, tamen se plurimum navibus posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: jam ergo, <hi rend="ital">in very fact</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ergo aliquis condemnavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:41:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 41, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25184.40" n="3" level="3"> In climax, <hi rend="ital">even, indeed, really</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus Paniceis, opus Placentinis quoque ... jam maritumi omnes milites opus sunt mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam illa quae natura, non litteris, assecuti sunt, neque cum Graecia neque ulla cum gente sunt conferenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam in opere quis par Romano miles?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jamdudum: <entryFree id="n25185" type="main" key="jamdu_dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jam-dūdum</orth> (or separat. <orth extent="full" lang="la">jam dū-dum</orth>), <sense id="n25185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., long since, long before, a long time ago</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25185.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi ego jamdudum tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum audivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum, si des, porrexi manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum est intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jamdudum hic adsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem jamdudum et Cotta et Sulpicius exspectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod te jamdudum hortor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 23, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 13</bibl>: jamdudum tibi non imprudens adversabar, Plaut. Men. <cb n="JANI" /> 2, 3, 65: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum flebam,</quote> <trans><tr>I had been a long time weeping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum vincula pugnat exuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:772" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 772</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:867" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 867</bibl>.—Corresp. with cum: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum factum'st, quom abisti domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 40</bibl>.—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">quia jam non dudum ante lucem ad Veneris aedem venimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25185.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., i. q. jam modo, <hi rend="ital">this very instant, without delay, forthwith, immediately, directly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum sumite poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua jamdudum demittite cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum dominae more venire jube,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 80</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 843</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 405</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 483</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 457: candida jamdudum cingantur colla lacertis (i. q. statim),</quote> <trans><tr>instantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medios ire furores, jamdudum moriture, paras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum incumbere aratris, Dum, sicca tellure, licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 213</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jamjam: <entryFree id="n25186" type="main" key="jamjam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jam-jam</orth> (or separat. <orth extent="full" lang="la">jam jam</orth>), <itype>the strengthened jam</itype>, <sense id="n25186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">already, now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o jamjam, optume, praeceptis paruisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamjam faciam ut jusseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamjam intellego, Crasse, quid dicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamjam nulla mora est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamjam casurae arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 588</bibl></cit>; v. jam, I. A. 1. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
jamjamque: <entryFree id="n25187" type="main" key="jamjamque^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jam-jamquĕ</orth> (or separat. <orth extent="full" lang="la">jam jam-quĕ</orth>). <sense id="n25187.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">At this very moment, just now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae potest in vita esse jucunditas, cum dies et noctes cogitandum sit, jamjamque esse moriendum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Romae essem et te jamjamque visurum me putarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar adventare jamjamque et adesse ejus equites nuntiabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25187.1" n="II" level="1"> The strengthened jam and jamjam, <hi rend="ital">already, now, just</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Umber Haeret hians, jam jamque tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 754</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">940</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 535</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 724</bibl>; v. jam, I. A. 1. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
jampridem: <entryFree id="n25188" type="main" key="jampri_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jam-prīdem</orth> (and separat. <orth extent="full" lang="la">jam prī-dem</orth>; v. jam and pridem), <sense id="n25188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., long ago, long since, a long time ago</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id jam pridem sensi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Pseud. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is jam pridem mortuus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 14, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat jam pridem apud me reliquum pauxillulum nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam pridem quidem, cum vultus inter vos minime fraternos cernebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. nondum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te nunc etiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te nunc vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25188.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">This long time, now for a long time, hitherto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio equidem, et jam pridem cupio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam pridem hanc prolem cupio enumerare meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 717</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil jam sum pridem admiratus magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui bellum jam pridem parabat,</quote> <trans><tr>had long been preparing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:8:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritus ne traderetur Philippo, jam pridem hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 14</bibl></cit>; v. jam, I. A. 1. b., and pridem.</sense></entryFree>
jana: <entryFree id="n25189" type="main" key="Jana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for <sense id="n25189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Diana, the moon-goddess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9</bibl>; cf. the letter D.—</sense><sense id="n25189.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goddess of doors and passages</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Nat. 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
janalis: <entryFree id="n25190" type="main" key="Ja_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Janus</etym>, <sense id="n25190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Janus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:165" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
janeus: <entryFree id="n25191" type="gloss" key="ja_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jānĕus</orth>, <itype>janitor</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
janiculum: <entryFree id="n25192" type="main" key="Ja_ni^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Janus</etym>, <sense id="n25192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the hills of Rome, on which Janus was said to have built a citadel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 358</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:245" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 245</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 74 al.</bibl>— Hence, </sense><sense id="n25192.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Janiculum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Janiculum</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 784</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
janigena: <entryFree id="n25193" type="main" key="Ja_ni^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Janus-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n25193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">begotten by Janus, child of Janus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 381</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
janitor: <entryFree id="n25194" type="main" key="ja_ni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jānĭtor</orth> (‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">jānĭtos</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 27</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>janua</etym>, <sense id="n25194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a door-keeper, porter, janitor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus ecquis hic est janitor? aperite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janitor (indignum!) durā religate catenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque sedens vester primi prope limina tecti, janitor egressus videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 14, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:65" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n25194.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. </sense><sense id="n25194.2" n="A" level="2"> Caeli janitor, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Janus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:139" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25194.3" n="B" level="2"> (Ingens) janitor, of <hi rend="ital">Cerberus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 400</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
janitrices: <entryFree id="n25195" type="gloss" key="ja_ni^tri_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jānĭtrīces</orth>, corrupted from <foreign lang="greek">ei)nate/</foreign><foreign lang="greek">res</foreign>,<cb n="JANU" />  <sense id="n25195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wives of two brothers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 9, 7, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
janitrix: <entryFree id="n25196" type="main" key="ja_ni^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jānĭtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>janitor</etym>, <sense id="n25196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female door-keeper, a portress</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25196.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus hic solet cubitare custos, janitrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25196.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus janitrix Caesarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>planted in front of the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
janua: <entryFree id="n25197" type="main" key="ja_nu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jānŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Janus, i. e. ianus, from i, ire; cf. Sanscr. yāna, itio, incessus, from yā, ire</etym>, <sense id="n25197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a door, house-door</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25197.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: principem in sacrificando Janum esse voluerunt, quod ab eundo nomen est ductum: ex quo transitiones perviae, jani; <cit><quote lang="la">foresque in liminibus profanarum aedium januae nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam occludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ostium et januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indiligenter observare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reserare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 128</bibl></cit>.—The dog was commonly chained there; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, janua mordax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:126 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 126 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25197.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an entrance</hi> of any sort: <cit><quote lang="la">inferni janua regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 106</bibl></cit>;
