cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atri janua Ditis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:187" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:23" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eam urbem sibi Mithridates Asiae januam fore putasset,</quote> <trans><tr>the key of Asia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic locus est gemini janua vasta maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25197.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an entrance, approach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua nolui janua sum ingressus in causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facillime vos ad ea, quae cupitis, perventuros, ab hoc aditu januaque patefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa januam Famae patefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:231" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus ac frons, quae est animi janua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 11:44" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum ostium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
janual: <entryFree id="n25198" type="gloss" key="Ja_nu^al"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānŭal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: libi genus, quod Jano tantummodo libatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=104" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 104</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
janualis: <entryFree id="n25199" type="main" key="Ja_nu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Janus</etym>, <sense id="n25199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Janus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus Januales (al. Janulii), Paul. ex Fest. s. v. axamenta: Janualis porta dicta ab Jano: et ideo ibi positum Jani signum, et jus institutum a Numa Pompilio, ut scribit in annalibus L. Piso, ut sit clausa semper, nisi cum bellum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=165" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 165</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:127" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
januarius: <entryFree id="n25200" type="main" key="Ja_nu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Janus</hi>.—Esp., </sense><sense id="n25200.1" n="A" level="2"> Januarius mensis, <hi rend="ital">the month of January</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctio constituta in mensem Januarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Januario mense cura ut Romae sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. mensis), <hi rend="ital">January</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a. d. VII. Idus Januarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25200.2" n="B" level="2"> Kalendae Januariae, <hi rend="ital">the first day of January</hi>. This was a festival on which the Romans presented their good wishes to each other It was also regarded as a fortunate day on which to begin any undertaking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonae Januariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
janus: <entryFree id="n25201" type="main" key="Ja_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root i, ire, prop. a going, a going through, passage; cf. janua</etym>, <sense id="n25201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old Italian deity</hi>. He was represented with a face on the front and another on the back of his head, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:245" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 245</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, anceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 334</bibl></cit>. The month of January, Mensis Jani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 51</bibl>, was sacred to him, as were all other beginnings. The myth makes him a king of Latium or Etruria, where he hospitably received Saturn when expelled by Jupiter from Crete, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7, 8, 9</bibl>. He had a small temple in the Forum, with two doors opposite to each other, which in time of war stood open and in time of peace were shut; <cit><quote lang="la">the temple was thrice closed on this account: in the time of Numa, after the first Punic war, and after the battle of Actium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:281" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 281</bibl></cit>. With reference to his temple, the deity was called Janus geminus, or Janus Quirinus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 22</bibl>; for which, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janus Quirini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.—Joined with pater: <cit><quote lang="la">Januspater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25201.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25201.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The temple of Janus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janum ad infimum Argiletum indicem pacis bellique fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25201.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An arched passageway, covered passage, arcade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">janos tres faciendos locavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25201.4" n="C" level="2"> In partic., <pb n="1013" /> <cb n="JEJU" /> Jani, <hi rend="ital">four arched passages in the Roman Forum, where the merchants and moneychangers had their stand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Puteal Janumque timet, celeresque Calendas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Janus summus ab imo Prodocet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam omnis res mea Janum Ad medium fracta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:25:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 25, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25201.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vive, vale et totidem venturos congere Janos, quot, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 20, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
januspater: <entryFree id="n25202" type="main" key="Ja_nuspa^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jānus-păter</orth>, v. Janus.</entryFree>
javolenus: <entryFree id="n25203" type="main" key="Ja^vo^le_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jăvŏlēnus</orth>, v. Jabolenus.</entryFree>
jaxamatae: <entryFree id="n25204" type="main" key="Jaxa^ma^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jaxămătae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the lake Mæotis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:146" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 31</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ixămătae</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:17" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jaxartes: <entryFree id="n25205" type="main" key="Jaxartes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jaxartes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Sogdiana</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sir</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sihoon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jazyges: <entryFree id="n25206" type="main" key="Ja_zy^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jāzyges</orth>, v. Iazyges.</entryFree>
jecinerosus: <entryFree id="n25207" type="main" key="je^ci^ne^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jĕcĭnĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jecur</etym>, <sense id="n25207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has the liver complaint</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jecoralis: <entryFree id="n25208" type="gloss" key="je^co^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jĕcŏrālis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">h(patiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
jecoriticus: <entryFree id="n25209" type="main" key="je^co^ri^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jĕcŏrĭtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jecur</etym>, <sense id="n25209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has the liver complaint</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jecorosus: <entryFree id="n25210" type="main" key="je^co^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jĕcŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has the liver complaint</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jectura: <entryFree id="n25211" type="main" key="jectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jacio</etym>, <sense id="n25211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing, casting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 45</bibl> dub. (al. ejectura).</sense></entryFree>
jecur: <entryFree id="n25212" type="main" key="je^cur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jĕcur</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcur</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 76</bibl> Sillig. <sense id="n25212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), jecŏris, jĕcĭnŏris, and <itype>jĕcĭnŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindred to Sanscr. yakrit, jecur, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(=par</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">the liver</hi>.—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum, cor, pulmones, jecur: haec enim sunt domicilia vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portae jecoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput jecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius quoque visceris morbus id est jocinoris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—The goose's liver was considered a delicacy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 26, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:58:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 58, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 88</bibl>. So, too, that of swine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 209</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25212.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. as the seat of the soul and affections: <cit><quote lang="la">non ancilla tuum jecur ulceret ulla puerve,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervens difficili bile tumet jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta siccum jecur ardeat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabie jecur incendente feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:647" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 647</bibl></cit>.—As the seat of the understanding: en cor Zenodoti, en jecur Cratetis, Bibacul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jecusculum: <entryFree id="n25213" type="main" key="je^cuscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jĕcuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>jecur</etym>, <sense id="n25213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little liver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 76, § 196</bibl>; or <orth extent="full" lang="la">jocusculum</orth>, Plin. l. l., Jahn; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jejunatio: <entryFree id="n25214" type="main" key="je_ju_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jējūnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jejuno</etym>, <sense id="n25214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fasting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jejunator: <entryFree id="n25215" type="main" key="je_ju_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jējūnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a faster</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 86" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jov. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jejune: <entryFree id="n25216" type="main" key="je_ju_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jējūnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. jejunus <sense id="n25216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
jejuniosus: <entryFree id="n25217" type="main" key="je_ju_ni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jējūnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>com. <hi rend="ital">intens.</hi> form, from jejunus</etym>, <sense id="n25217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fasting, hungry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque jejuniosiorem (diem) nec magis ecfertum fame vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jejunitas: <entryFree id="n25218" type="main" key="je_ju_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jējūnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fasting, emptiness of stomach</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25218.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunitatis plenus, anima foetida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25218.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calida umoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25218.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25218.4" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">dryness, poverty, meagreness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopia et jejunitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jejunitatem et famem se malle quam ubertatem et copiam dicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunitas et siccitas et inopia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:285" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 285</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25218.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ignorance</hi> of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">bonarum artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jejunium: <entryFree id="n25219" type="main" key="je_ju_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jējūnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fast-day, fast</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25219.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunium Cereri instituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos longa domant inopi jejunia victu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:534" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:535" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunia indicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunio aegrum vexare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25219.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25219.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hunger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vacuis spargit jejunia venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 820</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunia pascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:263" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placare voracis jejunia ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 95</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunia undae,</quote> <trans><tr>thirst</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 332</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25219.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Leanness, poorness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invalidique patrum referant jejunia nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25219.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Barrenness, unproductiveness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">macram ac tenuem terram jejunio laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jejuno: <entryFree id="n25220" type="main" key="je_ju_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jējūno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fast</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Abraham peregrinis prandentibus cibos jejunaturus apposuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jejunas laeta sit facies tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25220.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat., to abstain from</hi> a thing: <cb n="JOCA" /> Adam salvus alioquin, si uni arbusculae jejunare maluisset, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a justa fruge naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 16</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jejunus: <entryFree id="n25221" type="main" key="je_ju_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jējūnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. to Sanscr. yam, refrenare, cohibere; <hi rend="ital">intens.</hi> yanyam, Bopp. Gloss. p. 276, a</etym>, <sense id="n25221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fasting, hungry, abstinent, not partaking of food</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25221.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scenam qui jejunus venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. prol. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic expletur jejuna cupido,</quote> <trans><tr>hunger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 876</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jejuna aviditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misera ac jejuna plebecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quidem biduum ita jejunus fuissem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejuna fessaque corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 55</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus jejunis dentibus acer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerberus jejuno sono,</quote> <trans><tr>with hungry howlings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">tam jejuna fames?</quote> <trans><tr>so extreme</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus ad quem volat mater jejuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:232" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on an empty stomach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saliva,</quote> <trans><tr>fasting spittle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25221.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thirsty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilem jejunae saepe negavit aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 14), 18.—</sense><sense id="n25221.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25221.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dry, barren, unproductive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora suco jejuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 845</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:37:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 37, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glarea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars jejunior humi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25221.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Scanty, insignificant</hi> in quantity: <cit><quote lang="la">summaque jejunā sanie infuscatur arena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 493</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25221.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25221.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Poor, barren, powerless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quosdam nimis jejuno animo et angusto monerem uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pusillus animus atque ipsā malevolentiā jejunus atque inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25221.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Insignificant, trifling, contemptible, mean, low</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solivaga cognitio et jejuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida et jejuna calumnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunum hoc nescio quid et contemnendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid humile et jejunum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25221.9" n="C" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">meagre, dry, feeble, spiritless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis aut Antonium jejuniorem, aut Crassum fuisse pleniorem putet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theodorus, in arte subtilior, in orationibus jejunior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 48</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concertatio verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:17 al" default="NO">10, 2, 17 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25221.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Destitute of, without, deprived of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiarum avidi ac jejuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jējūnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">meagrely, dryly, jejunely, without ornament</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejune et exiliter disputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 112</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere jejunius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jentaculum: <entryFree id="n25222" type="main" key="jenta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jentācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>jento</etym>, <sense id="n25222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breakfast</hi>, taken immediately after rising, by children, valetudinarians, etc. (whereas the prandium was not taken till towards noon): <cit><quote lang="la">epulas interdum quadrifariam dispertiebat: in jentacula et prandia et cenas comissationesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:233" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 233</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me inferre Veneri vovi jam jentaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jentatio: <entryFree id="n25223" type="main" key="jenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breakfasting, breakfast</hi>, Firm. Math. 2, 10.</sense></entryFree>
jento: <entryFree id="n25224" type="main" key="jento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>contr. for jejunito from jejunus</etym>, <sense id="n25224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to breakfast</hi>: quod pulli jentent, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 14</bibl>; Afran. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jentes, sero venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:67" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jeremias: <entryFree id="n25225" type="main" key="Je_re^mi_as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jērĕmīas</orth> (scanned Īĕrĕmīas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 450</bibl>: <sense id="n25225.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Jērĕmĭās,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> Ev. Hist. 3, 269</bibl></cit>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Hebrew prophet Jeremiah</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo Domini quem locutus fuerat per os Jeremiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:36:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 36, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 27, 1</bibl> et saep.; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭērēmīās</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jericho: <entryFree id="n25226" type="main" key="Jeri^cho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jerĭcho</orth>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n25226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indecl., the Hebrew city Jericho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 10, 5</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
jesus: <entryFree id="n25227" type="main" key="Je_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jēsus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭēsus</orth>, trisyl.), <itype>u</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ihsou=s</foreign>, a Hebrew name; esp., <sense id="n25227.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Jesus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venturum praemisso nomine Jesum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 12, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Arat. Act. Apost. 1, 274: Nazara, cui felix patria est et nomen lësus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25227.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Joshua</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:Apost. 7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. Apost. 7, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 5, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
joannes: <entryFree id="n25228" type="main" key="Jo_annes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jōannes</orth> (trisyl. and quadrisyl.) and</entryFree>
joannis: <entryFree id="n25229" type="main" key="Jo_annis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jōannis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iwa/nnhs</foreign>. <sense id="n25229.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">John the Baptist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Nom.</hi> Joannis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25229.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">John the Evangelist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Nom.</hi> Joannis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jocabundus: <entryFree id="n25230" type="main" key="jo^ca_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jocor</etym>, <sense id="n25230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sportive, jocular</hi> (post-class.): juventus, Val. <cb n="JOCU" /> Max. 2, 4, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>: satura, Mart Cap. 6, § 576.</sense></entryFree>
jocaliter: <entryFree id="n25231" type="hapax" key="jo^ca_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>jocus</etym>, for joculariter, <sense id="n25231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jestingly, in joke</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 3</bibl> dub. (al. joculariter, al. localiter).</sense></entryFree>
jocatio: <entryFree id="n25232" type="main" key="jo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jocor</etym>, <sense id="n25232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joking, joke</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc venio ad jocationes tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jocinor: <entryFree id="n25233" type="main" key="jo^ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcĭnor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype> (jocineris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 38, § 80</bibl>), <sense id="n25233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the liver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus jocinoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; v. jecur.</sense></entryFree>
joco: <entryFree id="n25234" type="main" key="jo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. jocor.</entryFree>
jocor: <entryFree id="n25235" type="main" key="jo^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n25235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [jocus], <hi rend="ital">to jest, joke</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tu hanc jocari credis? faciet, nisi caveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex jocandi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluit Fortuna jocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25235.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to say in jest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec jocatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquid permulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscaena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:497" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 497</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 46</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏco</orth>, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi jocabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit> (al. jocabor).</sense></entryFree>
jocose: <entryFree id="n25236" type="main" key="jo^co_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. jocosus <sense id="n25236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
jocosus: <entryFree id="n25237" type="main" key="jo^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jocus</etym>, <sense id="n25237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of jesting, jocose, humorous, droll, facetious</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n25237.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">homo humanus et jocosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:354" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 354</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25237.2" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:692" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: Nilus, <hi rend="ital">the sportive Nile</hi>, with reference to the merry lives of the Egyptians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:80" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 80</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏ-cōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">jestingly, jocosely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eumque lusi jocose satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid jocosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
joculanter: <entryFree id="n25238" type="main" key="jo^cu^lanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. joculor <sense id="n25238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
jocularis: <entryFree id="n25239" type="main" key="jo^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>joculus</etym>, <sense id="n25239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">facetious, jocular, laughable, droll</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">joculare istuc quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <hi rend="ital">plur., jests, jokes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui jocularia ridens Percurram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlā-rĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">jocosely, in a jocular</hi> or <hi rend="ital">comical manner</hi>: irridere, Ps.-Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:in Caecin. 11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecin. 11, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obicere aliquid alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 38, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jocularius: <entryFree id="n25240" type="main" key="jo^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ludicrous, droll</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
joculatio: <entryFree id="n25241" type="main" key="jo^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>joculor</etym>, <sense id="n25241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jest, joke</hi> (post-class.): joculationes cantusque exercebant, Firm. Math. 5, 5.</sense></entryFree>
joculator: <entryFree id="n25242" type="main" key="jo^cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jester, joker</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">huic joculatorem senem illum interesse sane nolui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 3</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: scenici, Firm. Math. 8, 22.</sense></entryFree>
joculatorius: <entryFree id="n25243" type="main" key="jo^cu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>joculator</etym>, <sense id="n25243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jesting, jocular</hi>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst., jests, jokes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">joculatoria quaedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 486</bibl></cit> P. (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 3</bibl>, the better reading is joculatorem; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.).</sense></entryFree>
joculor: <entryFree id="n25244" type="main" key="jo^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype> <etym>joculus</etym>, <sense id="n25244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to jest, joke;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incondita quaedam joculantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">jestingly, jokingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compellare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
joculus: <entryFree id="n25245" type="main" key="jo^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>jocus</etym>, <sense id="n25245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little jest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joke</hi> (a favorite word of Plautus): <cit><quote lang="la">per joculum et ludum oblectare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; usu. in <hi rend="ital">abl. manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">joculo dicere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to say a thing in jest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Egone te joculo modo ausim dicto aut facto fallere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25245.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏ-cŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">toys, playthings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jocundus: <entryFree id="n25246" type="main" key="jo^cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. jucundus (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Proc. 12, 6</bibl>.</entryFree>
jocur: <entryFree id="n25247" type="main" key="jo^cur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcur</orth>, v. jecur.</entryFree>
jocus: <entryFree id="n25248" type="main" key="jo^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<number>plur.</number> also <itype>joca, jocorum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; so always in Cic.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. akin to Sanscr. root div, ludere; cf. jucundus</etym>, <sense id="n25248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jest, joke</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">joci causa magistrum adhibes,</quote> <trans><tr>for the sake of the joke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensio redundabat hilaritate quadam et joco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad ludum et jocum facti videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicum joca seria, ut dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 26</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1014" /> <cb n="JUBA" /> 85: <cit><quote lang="la">joca atque seria cum humillimis agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seria ac jocos celebrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocum accipimus quod est contrarium serio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:68" default="NO">68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:94" default="NO">94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviva joco mordente facetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitare jocos cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 320</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of jests of love,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu tu querelas sive geris jocos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam praebere causas jocorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:147" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 147</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">pastime, sport</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus jusjurandum jocus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per jocum,</quote> <trans><tr>in jest, by way of a joke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">joco an serio haec dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 1</bibl>.—So, too, joco quid dictum est per jocum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne joco quidem mentiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ep. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">joco seriove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 53</bibl>: extra jocum or remoto joco, <hi rend="ital">joking aside, without joking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra jocum, bellus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remoto joco, tibi praecipio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus et jocus,</quote> <trans><tr>mere sport, a trifle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille facesse jocos: turpe est nescire puellam Ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 367</bibl></cit>.—Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">quam Jocus circumvolat et Cupido,</quote> <trans><tr>the god of jests</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jocusculum: <entryFree id="n25249" type="main" key="jo^cuscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŏcuscŭlum</orth>, see jecusculum.</entryFree>
jonas: <entryFree id="n25250" type="main" key="Jo_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jōnas</orth>, v. Ionas.</entryFree>
joppe: <entryFree id="n25251" type="main" key="Joppe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Joppē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">*)io/ph</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Joppa, a seaport of Palestine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jaffa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 68</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Joppĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Joppa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jordanes: <entryFree id="n25252" type="main" key="Jorda_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jordānes</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jordānis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Jordan, the principal river of Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 15, 15, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
joseph: <entryFree id="n25253" type="main" key="Jo_se_ph"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jōsēph</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōsēph</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype> <sense id="n25253.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of the patriarch Jacob</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:30:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 30, 24 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25253.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The husband of Mary, the mother of Jesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 272</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25253.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inhabitant of Arimathea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 27, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
josephus: <entryFree id="n25254" type="main" key="Jo_se_phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jōsēphus</orth>, i. <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Jewish historian, taken prisoner by Flavius Vespasian, of whom he prophesied that he would become emperor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jovialis: <entryFree id="n25255" type="main" key="Jo^vi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŏvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Jovis, Juppiter</etym>, <sense id="n25255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Jupiter</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incontinentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jovis: <entryFree id="n25256" type="main" key="Jo^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŏvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Juppiter <sense id="n25256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
jovisjurandum: <entryFree id="n25257" type="main" key="Jo^visju_randum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŏvis-jūrandum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swearing by Jupiter;</hi> for jus-jurandum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 45, 4</bibl> (but Vahl. reads jusjurandum Jovis, Trag. Fragm. v. 410).</sense></entryFree>
jovius: <entryFree id="n25258" type="main" key="Jo^vi^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŏvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Jovis</etym>, <sense id="n25258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Jupiter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 194</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25259" type="main" key="Jo^vi^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŏvĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of the emperor Diocletian</hi>.—</sense><sense id="n25259.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n25259.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŏ-vĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Diocletian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <trans><tr>a legion of honor instituted by Diocletian</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 418</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25259.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŏ-vĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same; hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŏvĭāni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">soldiers of Diocletian's legion of honor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 3, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
juba: <entryFree id="n25260" type="main" key="ju^ba1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flowing hair on the neck of an animal, the mane</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25260.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl></cit>: huic equus ille jubam quatiens, Cic. N. D. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> 2, 43, 111: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum jubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luduntque jubae per colla, per armos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 497</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25260.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the hair of the head</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the hairy neck</hi> of dogs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:111" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 111</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the crest</hi> of serpents, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 88</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the crest</hi> of a helmet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 785</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the comb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tuft of feathers</hi> on the head of cocks and other birds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 10</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the tail</hi> of a comet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the foliage</hi> of trees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mullorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the beards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n25260.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the historic style of writing: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (orationem) saepius ossa, musculi, nervi: illam (historiam) tori quidam, et quasi jubae decent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25261" type="main" key="Ju^ba2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two Numidian-kings</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25261.1" n="I" level="1"> Juba I., <hi rend="ital">king of Numidia and a part of Mauretania, who joined the party of Pompey, gained a victory over Cæsar's legate Curio, and put an end to his own life after the battle of Thapsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 25 and 43.—</sense><sense id="n25261.2" n="II" level="1"> Juba II., <hi rend="ital">the son of the former, who, after his father's death, was brought by Cæsar to Rome, where he received a liberal education, and won</hi> <cb n="JUBE" /> <hi rend="ital">himself great reputation by his historical works and works on the history of art. He married the daughter of Antony and Cleopatra, and was afterwards reinstated in his paternal kingdom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:139" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 27, 31, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jubar: <entryFree id="n25262" type="main" key="ju^bar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭbar</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype> (<gen>m.</gen>: albus jubar, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 658</bibl> P.; Auct. Aetna, 332), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. juba</etym>, <sense id="n25262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the radiance of the heavenly bodies, light, splendor, brightness, sunshine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25262.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">it portis jubare exorto delecta juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 130</bibl></cit>; cf.: jubar stella, quam Graeci appellant <foreign lang="greek">fwsfo/ron</foreign> vel <foreign lang="greek">e(/speron</foreign>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=104" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 104</bibl> Müll.: quintus ab aequoreis nitidum jubar extulit undis Lucifer. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:149" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubar aureus extulerat sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 663</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:93" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 93</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:944" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 944</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc animam interea, caeso de corpore raptam, Fac jubar,</quote> <trans><tr>make into a constellation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 840</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25262.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a splendid appearance, splendor, glory, radiance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ille vultus flammeum intendens jubar, Sed fessus ac dejectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 448" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureum fundens Caesar ab ore jubar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:65:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 65, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jubatus: <entryFree id="n25263" type="main" key="ju^ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a mane</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crest, crested</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">devolant angues jubati deorsum in inpluvium duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 6</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 20, § 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jubeo: <entryFree id="n25264" type="main" key="ju^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭbĕo</orth>, <itype>jussi, jussum</itype> (jusso for jussero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 467</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:175" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 175</bibl>: <sense id="n25264.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">justi for jussisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussitur for jubetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14</bibl></cit>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perh. = jus habere, to regard as right, hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to order</hi> one to do something, <hi rend="ital">to bid, tell, command</hi> (syn.: mando, impero, praecipio). </sense><sense id="n25264.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">jubesne? jubeo, cogo atque impero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut justi (jussisti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defessa jubendo, est saeva Jovis conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic jubeo, stat pro ratione voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 223</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n25264.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubeto, istos foras exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae me litterae Dolabellae jubent ad pristinas cogitationes reverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perdicca pueros equos jussit conscendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos suum adventum exspectare jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit> so with <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos iratos Tarentinis relinqui jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25264.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet sententiam ut dicat suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubere ut haec quoque referret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 36, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:38" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:19" default="NO">5, 13, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussitque ut quae venissent naves Euboeam peterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 121</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp. of decrees of the people: senatus decrevit populusque jussit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:67:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 67, § 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19</bibl> (cf. II. B. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">quod ne fieret, consules jusserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:52" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 52</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25264.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone (ante-class. and postAug., Madv. Gr. § <cit><quote lang="la">390): jube, mihi denuo respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10, 4</bibl>; cf. esp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:27:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 27, 3 sq.</bibl> Weissenb.; <cit><quote lang="la">28, 36, 2: rescribat multa jubeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 795</bibl>: 11, 588 al.—</sense><sense id="n25264.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui scribae ... deos iratos Tarentinis relinqui jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules sacrorum custodibus jussit, ne mulierem interesse permitterent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus jusserat, ut instantibus resisterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannico jussit, exsurgeret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis rex cultu feminarum abstinere jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> vel <hi rend="ital">rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube famulos, rem divinam mihi apparent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae non quae te aliquid juberent, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tu jussisses Eurysthea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:66:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 66, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque jubere caedem fratris palam audebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero jussit scelera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum iis Drusus jusserat modicum,</quote> <trans><tr>imposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">II. B. 2. infra: pacem jubebo Omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 32</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod jussi sunt faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules jubentur scribere exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opto ut ea potissimum jubear, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanos non juberi, non regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussi sunt aegri deferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locus lautiaque legatis praeberi jussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25264.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25264.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To wish, desire, entreat, bid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubeto habere bonum animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperare nos amici jubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: valde <cb n="JUCU" /> jubeo gaudere te, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar te sine cura esse jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysium jube salvere,</quote> <trans><tr>salute him for me</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>. —So ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">jubeo Chremetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25264.8" n="B" level="2"> In polit. lang. </sense><sense id="n25264.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To order, decree, ratify, approve</hi> the introduction of a proposed law: <cit><quote lang="la">quae scisceret plebs aut quae populus juberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,017:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Flac. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem populus Romanus jussit de civitate tribuenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere apud populum de legibus jubendis aut vetandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 60</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de omnibus his—populum jussisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25264.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To designate, appoint, assign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tullum Hostilium regem populus jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>
