Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">id modo excepere ne postea eosdem tribunos juberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem vos imperatorem jussistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ei provinciam Numidiam populus jussit,</quote> <trans><tr>allotted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 84:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 84, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25264.11" n="3" level="3"> Hence the formula, Velitis, jubeatis, with which the magistrates called upon the people to confirm any thing proposed to them: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem promulgavit: vellent, juberent Philippo regi bellum indici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25264.12" n="C" level="2"> Med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to prescribe, order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod jussi ei dari bibere, date,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 56, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrotus, qui jussus sit vinum sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25264.13" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui modo, si volucres habuissem regna jubentes, In populo potui maximus esse meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:461" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 461</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juberna: <entryFree id="n25265" type="main" key="Ju^berna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭberna</orth>, v. Juverna.</entryFree>
jubilaeus: <entryFree id="n25266" type="main" key="ju_bi^laeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūbĭlaeus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">jūbĕlaeus; jŭb-</orth>, incorrectly), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">i)wbhlai=os</foreign>; Hebr. jōbēl</etym>, <sense id="n25266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the year of jubilee among the Jews</hi>, in which all slaves were set free and all lands reverted to their former possessors; it took place every fifty years: quinquagesimus annus Cum Jubilaeus adest, Arat. Act. Apost. 2, 677; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 16, 58, 6 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
jubilatio: <entryFree id="n25267" type="main" key="ju_bi^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūbĭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jubilo</etym>, <sense id="n25267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shouting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jubilatus: <entryFree id="n25268" type="gloss" key="ju_bi^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūbĭlātus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">o)lolugmo/s, kraugh\ a)groi/kwn</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
jubilo: <entryFree id="n25269" type="main" key="ju_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūbĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n25269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [jubilum], <hi rend="ital">to shout, to raise a shout of joy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiritare, jubilare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 68</bibl></cit> Müll.: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to call out to</hi> a person: io buccol quis me jubilat? <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">jubilate Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:99:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 99, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectu regis Domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 99, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jubilum: <entryFree id="n25270" type="main" key="ju_bi^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūbĭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild cry, shout, shepherd's song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivit jubila Cyclops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:475" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montana jubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:80" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jucunde: <entryFree id="n25271" type="main" key="ju_cunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūcundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. jucundus <sense id="n25271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
jucunditas: <entryFree id="n25272" type="main" key="ju_cundi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūcundĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jucundus</etym>, <sense id="n25272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreeableness, pleasantness, delight, enjoyment</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis morbis vitae jucunditas impeditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistola plena jucunditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with delectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare se jucunditati,</quote> <trans><tr>to give one's self up to enjoyment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucunditate perfundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea est in homine jucunditas, ut,</quote> <trans><tr>cheerfulness, liveliness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil mihi ex plurimis tuis jucunditatibus gratius accidit, quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>good offices, favors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jucundo: <entryFree id="n25273" type="main" key="ju_cundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūcundo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to please, delight;</hi> mid., jucundari, <hi rend="ital">to feel delighted, take delight</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">consolationes Dei jucundant animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gen. ad Litt. 12:34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gen. ad Litt. 12, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ex Psa. 94, 19: quotidie autem jucundabar ante faciem ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>; ex Prov. 8, 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:11:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 11, 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
jucundus: <entryFree id="n25274" type="main" key="ju_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūcundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">jōcundus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jocus</etym>, <sense id="n25274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pleasant, agreeable, delightful, pleasing</hi> (syn.: gratus, blandus; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): est mihi jucunda in malis et grata in dolore vestra erga me voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id vero militibus fuit pergratum et jucundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ad audiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucunda captat praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:36" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine amore jocisque nil est jucundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crispi jucunda senectus (i. e. senex jucundus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua potui jucunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 32, 37, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro jucundis aptissima quaeque dabunt di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:349" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 349</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia jucundiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum jucundius vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:180" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 180</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucundissimi ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectus vester est mihi multo jucundissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūcundē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">agreeably, delight</hi> <pb n="1015" /> <cb n="JUDI" /> <hi rend="ital">fully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantare et psallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba jucunde olet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 69, § 177</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere jucundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 57</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> 6, 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">ext</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
juda: <entryFree id="n25275" type="main" key="Ju_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūda</orth>, v. Judas.</entryFree>
judaea: <entryFree id="n25276" type="main" key="Ju_daea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūdaea</orth> (post-Aug.; in inscrr. and coins IVDEA, Cohen, Descr. Hist. Monn. 1, 310 sqq.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ioudai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n25276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the country of the Jews, Judea, Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25276.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n25276.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jū-daeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ioudai=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Judea, Jewish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 8, 44, § 95</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūdaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Jews</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:547" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:18" default="NO">3, 18</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūdaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Jewess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:543" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 543</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25276.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūdăïcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Jewish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:101" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <trans><tr>over the Jews</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in Judea</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>unleavened</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūdăĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Jewish manner, superstitiously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:18:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 18, 26</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">In the Hebrew language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exclamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:18:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 18, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
judaismus: <entryFree id="n25277" type="main" key="Ju_da^ismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūdăismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Judaism</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
judaizo: <entryFree id="n25278" type="main" key="Ju_da^i_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūdăīzo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n25278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to live in the Jewish manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
judas: <entryFree id="n25279" type="main" key="Ju_das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūdas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jūda</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iou/das</foreign>. <sense id="n25279.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Judah, son of Jacob and patriarch of one of the tribes of Israel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istae sunt familiae Juda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit Judas fratribus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 37, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25279.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the tribe of Judah, descendants of Judah</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diebus illis salvabitur Juda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of the land inhabited by the tribe, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 10, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25279.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Jude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Judas, one of Christ's apostles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 13, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25279.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Judas Iscariot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 428</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25279.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Judas Machabæus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Macc. 2, 4</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
judex: <entryFree id="n25280" type="main" key="ju_dex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>com.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>: <sense id="n25280.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">et sumus, ut fateor, tam saevā judice sontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 368</bibl></cit>; cf. 227; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 428</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 91</bibl>; Petr. poët. 122, v. 174 al.) [jus-, 2. dico], <hi rend="ital">a judge</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n25280.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex, quod judicat acceptā potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 61</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">verissimus judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequam et levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctissimus et justissimus plurimarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severissimi atque integerrimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud judices causam agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere aliquem judicem de re quapiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere judicem in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 38, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse judicem de re pecuniaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequum se judicem rei alicui praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judici litem committere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 80</bibl></cit>: judicem ferre alicui, <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">propose a judge to any one</hi>, which was done by the plaintiff: <cit><quote lang="la">ni ita esset, multi privatim ferebant Volscio judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei M. Flaccus, multis probris objectis, P. Mucium judicem tulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl></cit>: judicem dicere, <hi rend="ital">to name a judge</hi>, which was done by a defendant who was willing to submit the cause to a trial, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56</bibl>: dare judicem, <hi rend="ital">to grant a judge</hi>, this was done by the prætor, who proposed the judges from whom the parties made their selection, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 12, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 18</bibl>: judices petere, <hi rend="ital">to solicit judges</hi>, i. e. to ask that the cause be tried, not before the Senate, but before the ordinary judges, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 2</bibl>.—Sometimes judex stands for consul: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Quirites, ite ad conventionem huc ad judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=88" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 88</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n25280.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a judge, decider, umpire</hi> in any matter: <cit><quote lang="la">cape, opsecro hercle, una cum eo judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>, Lorenz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequissimus eorum studiorum existimator et judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego Daphnim Judice te metuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">judice me,</quote> <trans><tr>in my judgment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:188" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se judice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judice te non sordidus auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatici certant et adhuc sub judice lis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus atque fidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonum candide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex morum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a censor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
judicabilis: <entryFree id="n25281" type="main" key="ju_di^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>judico</etym>, <sense id="n25281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be judged of</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 461</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">judicial, befitting a judge</hi>: judicabili <cb n="JUDI" /> vigore et censoria auctoritate, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
judicatio: <entryFree id="n25282" type="main" key="ju_di^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>judico</etym>. <sense id="n25282.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A judging, investigating</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">longi subsellii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence,</quote> <trans><tr>an inquiry into an accusation, a judicial examination of a cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium est ratio quaedam habens in se et inventionem et judicationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25282.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a judgment, opinion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitralis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poetarum et carminum,</quote> <trans><tr>a critical estimate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 338</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
judicato: <entryFree id="n25283" type="main" key="ju_di^ca_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. judico, <sense id="n25283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
judicatorium: <entryFree id="n25284" type="gloss" key="ju_di^ca_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātōrĭum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">dikasth/rion</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
judicatorius: <entryFree id="n25285" type="main" key="ju_di^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>judicator</etym>, <sense id="n25285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a judge, judicial</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">rigor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 54" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
judicatrix: <entryFree id="n25286" type="main" key="ju_di^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that judges</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decides</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ars inventrix, et judicatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
judicatum: <entryFree id="n25287" type="main" key="ju_di^ca_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. judico, <sense id="n25287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
judicatus: <entryFree id="n25288" type="main" key="ju_di^ca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. judico <sense id="n25288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25289" type="main" key="ju_di^ca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>judico</etym>, <sense id="n25289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a judgeship, the office of a judge</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">isti ordini judicatus lege Julia non patebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatu illo solvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
judicialis: <entryFree id="n25290" type="main" key="ju_di^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>judicium</etym>, <sense id="n25290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the courts of justice, judicial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the year in which Pompey altered the form of trials</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:243" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: genus, <hi rend="ital">rhetorical speeches containing an accusation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a defence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta judicialis,</quote> <trans><tr>where justice is administered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 3, 31.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭ-cĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">judicially</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
judiciarius: <entryFree id="n25291" type="main" key="ju_di^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the courts, judiciary</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lex Julia judiciaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:104" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
judiciolum: <entryFree id="n25292" type="main" key="ju_di^ci^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeble judgment</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">juste, an secus, non judicioli est nostri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">28, 4, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
judicium: <entryFree id="n25293" type="main" key="ju_di^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>judex</etym>, <sense id="n25293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a judgment</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a judicial investigation, trial; a judicial sentence</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n25293.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia judicia aut distrahendarum controversiarum aut puniendorum maleficiorum causā reperta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis meae,</quote> <trans><tr>concerning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor judicium prius de probro, quam de re fieri maluit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de alicujus meritis judicia facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 41, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mea fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter sicarios,</quote> <trans><tr>for assassination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adducere causam aliquam in judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicio aliquid defendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 20, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to settle a dispute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl></cit>: ferre, <hi rend="ital">to give his vote;</hi> of a judge (different from sententiam ferre, to pass sentence), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,005:page=525" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tog. Cand. p. 525</bibl> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare aliquem in judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>to summon before court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicio quempiam arcessere,</quote> <trans><tr>to sue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistere in judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>to set before the court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: dare, <hi rend="ital">to allow, grant a trial</hi>, of the prætor who proposes the judges: <cit><quote lang="la">in Lurconis libertum judicium ex edicto dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 35, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium accipere, suscipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to undertake a legal trial</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 20, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati,</quote> <trans><tr>to submit to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 20, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatus inani judicio Marius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25293.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25293.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A court of justice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at ille in judicium venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ep. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium clauserat militibus armatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25293.4" n="B" level="2"> Beyond the legal sphere, <hi rend="ital">a judgment, decision, opinion</hi> with regard to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">meum semper judicium fuit, omnia nostros invenisse per se sapientius quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decima legio per tribunos militum ei gratias egit, quod de se optimum judicium fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium facere, quanti quisque sibi faciendus esset,</quote> <trans><tr>to judge, decide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo judicio,</quote> <trans><tr>in my judgment, according to my opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alicujus judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 108</bibl></cit>: de quo homine vos tanta et tam praeclara <cb n="JUGA" /> judicia fecistis, i. e. by conferring honors on him, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 15, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25293.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The power of judging, judgment, discernment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio optimo, judicio minus firmo praeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 7, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid mei judicii est,</quote> <trans><tr>if I can judge of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videor id judicio facere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with discretion, good judgment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 30</bibl> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acri judicio perpendere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1042" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1042</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25293.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Judicial harangues, speeches in court</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa mala judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
judico: <entryFree id="n25294" type="main" key="ju_di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (judicassit for judicaverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>judex</etym>, <sense id="n25294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to examine judicially, to judge, be a judge, pass judgment, decide</hi> (syn.: judicium facio, reddo; class.). </sense><sense id="n25294.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si recte et ordine judicaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magistratus judicassit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo alius ad res judicandas postulatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicare, deberi viro dotem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in rebus judicandis spectatus et cognitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicantem vidimus Aeacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad judicandum evocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aut spoliaret fama probatum virum, si contra judicavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bene meritis civibus potestas judicandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:31:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 31, § 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aequo et bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi tris hodie litis judicandas dicito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">kindred acc.</hi>: inclytum judicium, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 114</bibl>. —Esp., </sense><sense id="n25294.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To condemn</hi> = damnare; <cit><quote lang="la">quo jam diu sum judicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicati atque addicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 14, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatum pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad vel capitis vel pecuniae judicasset privato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quique judicati pecuniae in vinculis essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicare aliquem pecuniae,</quote> <trans><tr>to fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:47" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui perduellionem judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25294.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the legal sphere. </sense><sense id="n25294.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To judge, judge of</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid oculorum fallacissimo sensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod egomet multis argumentis jam antea judicāram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic statuo et judico, neminem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25294.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To declare, proclaim</hi> a person to be any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">judicetur non verbo sed re, non modo non consul, sed etiam, hostis Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deiotarum unum fidelem populo Romano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus rei exemplum pulcherrimum judicarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25294.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To determine, resolve, conclude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de itinere ipsos brevi tempore judicaturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25294.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To adjudge, make over</hi> to a person: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ego ad Menaechmum nunc eo, cui jam diu Sum judicatus (al. quo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicata pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭ-cātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., decided, determined</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi judicatum est deponere illam personam,</quote> <trans><tr>I am determined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res judicata,</quote> <trans><tr>a decided matter taken as a precedent for other cases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 5, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmatio rerum judicatarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">sentenced, condemned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatum duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 63</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a matter judged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decided; a decision, judgment, precedent, authority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatum est id, de quo sententia lata est, aut decretum interpositum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatum est, de quo ante jam sententia alicujus ... constitutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,017:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Flac. 20, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis postea judicatum fiat, tamen actio data non intercidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25294.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An award, a fine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 13, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūdĭcātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">deliberately</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugabilis: <entryFree id="n25295" type="main" key="ju^ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jugo</etym>, <sense id="n25295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be joined together</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">competentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jugalis: <entryFree id="n25296" type="main" key="ju^ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jugum</etym>, <sense id="n25296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a yoke, yoked together</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25296.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi jumentaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi et currus jugalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgāles</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a team</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 280</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25296.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25296.3" n="A" level="2"> ŎS, <hi rend="ital">a bone above the ear, near the temple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25296.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fastened to the loom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25296.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Matrimonial, nuptial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui me vinclo vellem sociare jugali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1016" /> <cb n="JUGO" /> 496: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:222" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agm. 239" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agm. 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:38" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgālis</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a husband, spouse</hi>, Ven. Carm. 6, 2, 76.</sense></entryFree>
jugalitas: <entryFree id="n25297" type="main" key="ju^ga_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jugalis</etym>, <sense id="n25297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">union</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugamento: <entryFree id="n25298" type="main" key="ju^ga_mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgāmento</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">jŭgāmentum</orth>, v. jugumento, etc.</entryFree>
jugarius: <entryFree id="n25299" type="main" key="ju^ga_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jugum</etym>, <sense id="n25299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yoked together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vicus Jugarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a place in Rome where stood an altar to the foundress of marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 37, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25299.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an ox-herd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugatinus: <entryFree id="n25300" type="main" key="Ju^ga_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭgātīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>jugo</etym>, <sense id="n25300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of marriage</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9.</sense></entryFree>
jugatio: <entryFree id="n25301" type="main" key="ju^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding</hi> (e. g. of a vine) <hi rend="ital">to rails</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25301.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of land-measure</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 48, 1.</sense></entryFree>
jugator: <entryFree id="n25302" type="main" key="ju^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who yokes</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 174</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
juge: <entryFree id="n25303" type="main" key="ju_ge"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūge</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. jugis <sense id="n25303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
jugeralis: <entryFree id="n25304" type="main" key="ju_ge^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūgĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jugerum</etym>, <sense id="n25304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an acre, acre-</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tabula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jugeratim: <entryFree id="n25305" type="main" key="ju^ge^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgĕrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">per acre</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugeratio: <entryFree id="n25306" type="main" key="ju_ge^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūgĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n25306.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dividing of land into acres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Col. p. 146" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Col. p. 146</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25306.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A measure of land</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 33.</sense></entryFree>
jugerum: <entryFree id="n25307" type="main" key="ju_ge^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūgĕrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (in <number>sing.</number> acc. to the second, in <number>plur.</number> mostly acc. to the third declension; <sense id="n25307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> always jugerum; cf. Lachm. in Rhein. Mus. 1845, pp. 609-612), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an acre</hi>, or rather <hi rend="ital">juger</hi> of land, measuring 28,800 square feet, or 240 feet in length by 120 in breadth (whereas the English acre measures 43,560 square feet): <cit><quote lang="la">in Hispania ulteriore metiuntur jugis, in Campania versibus, apud nos in agro Romano ac Latino jugeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex jugero decumano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is partes fecit in ripa, nescio quotenorum jugerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donare clientem Jugeribus paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:163" default="NO">14, 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugifluus: <entryFree id="n25308" type="main" key="ju_gi^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūgĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. jugis-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n25308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ever-flowing</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 35, 439</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugis: <entryFree id="n25309" type="main" key="ju_gis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūgis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jungo</etym>, <sense id="n25309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joined together</hi>: auspicium, <hi rend="ital">marred auspices</hi>, occasioned by a yoke of oxen dunging at the same time, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 36, 77</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 537</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25310" type="main" key="ju_gis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūgis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n25310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> jugerum for jugium, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 40</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">with the first syll. short,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">adj., continual, perpetual;</hi> esp. of running water, <hi rend="ital">always flowing, perennial</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">thesaurus jugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex puteis jugibus aquam calidam trahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">holocaustum juge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium juge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugi sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lev. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabiem jugem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 20</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n25310.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūge</orth>, <hi rend="ital">continually, always, ever</hi> (post-class.): juge durans (anima), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 472.—</sense><sense id="n25310.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">jū-gĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">continually, perpetually; immediately, instantly</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Mund. p. 71</bibl>: jugiter atque perpetuo, Cod. Th. 16, 7, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:29:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 29, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 9, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugitas: <entryFree id="n25311" type="main" key="ju_gi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūgĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. jugis</etym>, <sense id="n25311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">continuance, duration</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl></cit>: temporis, Cod. 5, 17, 7; 12, 1, 186.</sense></entryFree>
jugiter: <entryFree id="n25312" type="main" key="ju_gi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūgĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. jugis <sense id="n25312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
juglans: <entryFree id="n25313" type="main" key="ju_glans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jūglans</orth>, <itype>glandis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>i. q. Jovis glans = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*dio\s ba/lanos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a walnut; a walnut-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec glans optima, et maxima, ab Jove et glande juglans appellata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=102" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 102</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">juglandium putamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juglandium umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 18, § 89</bibl></cit>.—Also with nux: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces juglandes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jugo: <entryFree id="n25314" type="main" key="ju^go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>jugum</etym>, <sense id="n25314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind to laths</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rails</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25314.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">furcas vel palos perticis jugare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:1" default="NO">12, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25314.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to marry</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cui pater intactam dederat, primisque jugarat Ominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 345</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25314.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to join, connect</hi>: sol vagus igneas habenas Immittit propius, jugatque terrae, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭ-gātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n25314.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Joined, connected</hi>: <cb n="JUGU" /> virtutes inter se nexae et jugatae sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 8, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25314.5" n="B" level="2"> Jugata verba, <hi rend="ital">derived from one another</hi> (as justus, justitia, juste), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 66</bibl>; cf. 5, 10, 94.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25315" type="main" key="jugo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jugo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n25315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to utter the</hi> note of the kite (milvus), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 2</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=104" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 104</bibl> Müll., and jugit <foreign lang="greek">ikti\n boa=|</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
jugosus: <entryFree id="n25316" type="main" key="ju^go_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jugum</etym>, <sense id="n25316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mountainous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
jugula: <entryFree id="n25317" type="main" key="Ju^gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jŭgŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jugulus</etym>, <sense id="n25317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the three stars which form Orion's belt;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">the whole constellation Orion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 50</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Jugulae neque Vesperugo neque Vergiliae occidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25317.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Two stars in the constellation Cancer</hi>, otherwise called <hi rend="ital">Aselli</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc Cancro vicina canam, cui parte sinistra Consurgunt Jugulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 175</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jugulatio: <entryFree id="n25318" type="main" key="ju^gu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>jugulo</etym>, <sense id="n25318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting of one's throat, a killing, murdering</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 16; 18; 22.</sense></entryFree>
jugulator: <entryFree id="n25319" type="main" key="ju^gu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutthroat, slayer, murderer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> ad Eccl. 3</bibl>; cf. jugulator, <foreign lang="greek">foneu/s, sfa/kths</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
jugulo: <entryFree id="n25320" type="main" key="ju^gu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>jugulum</etym>, <sense id="n25320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut the throat, to kill, slay, murder</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n25320.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jugulatur sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives optimos jugulari jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alicui tradere jugulandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem crudeliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">70: qui unum hominem jugulat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 18, 10</bibl></cit>.—Com. of hunger: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mi auctores fuere, ut egomet me hodie jugularem fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—Also of diseases: <cit><quote lang="la">quartana neminem jugulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id genus acutum est, et celeriter jugulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—In a pun: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non Hunc Regem jugulas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 35</bibl></cit>.—Pregn.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum rite sacratas in flammam jugulant pecudes,</quote> <trans><tr>slaughter and throw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 214</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25320.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to confute, convict, silence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem factis decretisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulari sua confessione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 64</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">166: jugulari suo gladio, suoque telo,</quote> <trans><tr>to be beaten with one's own weapons, foiled with one's own devices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio plumbeo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to overcome without difficulty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falernum,</quote> <trans><tr>to adulterate, spoil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:19:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive away, banish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 51, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jugulum: <entryFree id="n25321" type="main" key="ju^gu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>jug, jungo</etym>, <sense id="n25321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the collar-bone</hi>, which joins together the shoulders and the breast, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1, § 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uni homini juguli, humeri: ceteris armi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 43, 98, § 243</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25321.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, hence, <hi rend="ital">the hollow part of the neck above the collar-bone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod jugula concava non haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25321.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The throat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulum perfodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recludere stricto ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:285" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui jugulos aperire susurro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demittere gladium in jugulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: dare or praebere, <hi rend="ital">to present the throat</hi>, sc. to be cut, as was done by conquered gladiators, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25321.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25321.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A slaughter, murder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Electrae jugulo se polluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:218" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 218</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25321.5" n="B" level="2"> Petere, <hi rend="ital">to aim at the throat</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to attack the main point of one's argument</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulum causae premere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
jugum: <entryFree id="n25322" type="main" key="ju^gum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">jŭgum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindred to Sanscr. yuga from yug-, jungere; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">zugo/n</foreign>; v. jungo</etym>, <sense id="n25322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yoke</hi> for oxen, <hi rend="ital">a collar</hi> for horses. </sense><sense id="n25322.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos onera quibusdam bestiis, nos juga imponimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones jugo subdere, et ad currum jungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bos) juga detractans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauris solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena jugo concordia ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 542</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum excutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25322.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25322.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A yoke, pair, team</hi> of draught-cattle: <cit><quote lang="la">ut minus multis jugis ararent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:51:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 51, § 120</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a pair of horses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a pair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 4, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sociis juga pauca boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 108</bibl></cit>; also for <hi rend="ital">the chariot itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 594</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:683" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 683</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curtum temone jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25322.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A juger</hi> of land: <cit><quote lang="la">in Hispania ulteriore metiuntur jugis: jugum vocant, quod juncti boves uno die exarare possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 9</bibl>, the correct reading is jugerum; v. Sillig ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n25322.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A beam, lath</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rail fastened</hi> <cb n="JULI" /> <hi rend="ital">in a horizontal direction to perpendicular poles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">posts, a cross-beam, cross-rail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes in jugum insilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam sub jugum mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25322.6" n="4" level="3"> Esp. as the symbol of humiliation and defeat, <hi rend="ital">a yoke</hi>, consisting of two upright spears, and a third laid transversely upon them, under which vanquished enemies were made to pass: <cit><quote lang="la">cum male pugnatum apud Caudium esset, legionibus nostris sub jugum missis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum sub jugum mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
