G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 34, 9 al.</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">sub jugo mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n25322.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation Libra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam, in jugo cum esset luna, natam esse dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25322.8" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The beam of a weaver's loom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela jugo vincta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25322.9" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rower's bench</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 411</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25322.10" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A height</hi> or <hi rend="ital">summit of a mountain, a ridge;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a chain of mountains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in immensis qua tumet Ida jugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspectum jugum Cumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:191" default="NO">3, 191</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25322.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">yoke, bonds</hi> of slavery, matrimony, etc.: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Jamne ea fert jugum? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Tam a me pudicast quasi soror mea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus a cervicibus jugum servile dejecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus Diductos jugo cogit aëneo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuere,</quote> <trans><tr>to shake off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:11" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum subacta ferre jugum valet Cervice,</quote> <trans><tr>the yoke of marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>. —Of misfortune: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre jugum pariter dolosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari jugo niti,</quote> <trans><tr>to work with equal efforts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitates terroresque mortalium sub jugum mittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to subjugate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Prov. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de Prov. 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices, qui ferre incommoda vitae, nec jactare jugum vita didicere magistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
